text: We went on a Friday night and thanks to their renovation and added tables, there was virtually no wait time to be seated. The menu offers a fair amount of options-- I might even say too many, as some of the salads and bowls really have only one omition or addiction of ingredients separating them, making it somewhat redundant.  I'm vegan and it really seemed as though the two non-vegans who dined with me were more keen on the food than I was. My perception of Aux Vivres is that it's basically another trendy, Plateau hipster haunt that's geared towards capitalising on the vegan craze, targeting non-vegans more than vegans themselves.  I don't tend to cook with tons of seitan, TVP, tofu, tempeh, etc., nor do many other vegans I know, and yet most of their meals are laden with them. Fresh produce and inventive use of veggies (plus a chia seed there or a nut here) are more than enough to create an appetizing vegan meal. My veggie burger and fries were extremely, extremely heavy. The fries were more like soft slabs of potato than crispy French fries.  My two friends split a bowl (Dragon, I believe) and a BLT. The BLT was drenched in sauce and wasn't a taste I particularly enjoyed from the bite I had. I won't hurry back to the restaurant despite its relatively good service due to its overhyped, overpriced and under spiced food.

Whenever I go to or pass through Montreal, I have to stop here for their BLT on chipati. Smoked coconut, lettuce, tomato and (vegan?) mayonnaise. It's incredible. My one regret the last time I was there (last Sunday), that I didn't buy a BLT to go.

Smoothies here (Banana Blast with a touch of cocoa for me and Blue Monkey/Tropicana tries for the girlfriend) are delicious treats. They should not be passed up.  The food is equally wonderful. Healthy, filling portions of quality vegan ingredients. The salad was huge and colorful. I added coconut bacon from the BLT to it. Great choice. Girl got the Buddha bowl and enjoyed it. We came back again for sandwiches and shared half-each of the Dragon and Mekong sandwiches. Lovely food. Although it's on the pricier than bang-for-the-buck side, it's not enough to detract from a five-star rating in my book. They're open till 11pm on weeknights: THANK you. :)
A friend took me to this great vegan restaurant.  I had Buddha bowl and celery smoothie. The meal is very refreshing, tasty and creative. One of the best meals I had in Montreal.

A large very creative selection of vegetarian friendly food! Me and my friend ordered the Dragon rice bowl and a Chana wrap. The Dragon rice bowl was a little complicated for my tastes, (But thats completely  at the fault of me for ordering it, since I knew what I was getting) But I still really enjoyed all the fresh tasty vegetables on it. But WARNING: Those rice bowls could feed a family, if you're thinking about sharing it instead of ordering two, sharing would be the better option. The Chana was warm flavorful and something I could eat again and again. Plus they have a lovely selection of pastries which I have to go back to try!   OMG I almost forgot about the service too. It was so incredibly fast. My friend and I went to the restroom and when we came back the food was already at our places. It must have been less than 5 minutes. I've never had service so fast. The waitresses were also very smily and helpful when we were having troubles with the credit card machine. :D Great restaurant! If you're a vegetarian its a must!
This review is only about the cheesecake, which is amazing. Not dense, it's a fluffy cheesecake and had a really delicious berry topping. Sure it's $6, but it's a heaping helping.
We had the dragon and Buddha bowls. They were very good but as other reviewers have mentioned, rely on sauces instead of more flavorful ingredients.  No kids menu.  Fried potatoes were dry.

Oh I wanted so badly to give this place five stars! The food was magical. It was the best carrot cake of my life, no question. But the server did not check in, except to order our dessert, and did not even bring a water refill once, not even when I asked for one. Otherwise a wonderful dining experience. The latke burger is crazy good!

My favorite restaurant in all of Canada, and perhaps all of North America, and that said... probably the world. Okay, yes, this is my new favorite restaurant in the world.  Thank you for making me a vegan Gyro with Tzatsiki to die for everyday I was in Montreal. I know it was on the menu, but I feel like somehow the item was placed there with me in mind because everyday I go in, there seems to be yet another with my name on it and no matter how much I try to believe that my mind is a unique separate instance of cognizance, isolated from the universe, this sandwich is proof that someone out there knows me and my innermost thoughts, desires, hopes and dreams, and loves me enough to feed it to me, rather than using it against me as some form of sick torture like I would expect from an investigator into my psyche from some other, lesser creator, some sad restaurant that is not you. Yes, you are benevolence incarnate.   It's you, Aux Vivres. It's always been you. You complete me.  Blessings to you beautiful Aux Vivres!
Every believer of staff made us feel every one of special and was attentive. It was a in fact customary dining experience to be repeated.
This is a solid vegan place.i love checking their specials and the breakfast burrito in their to go store is one of the absolute best.  They're worth checking out for brunch too!

Pretty tasty for vegan. I ventured out to Aux Vivres early on a Thursday (6pm) to be sure to get a spot as this resto always looks full!  My friends ordered the Thai bowl and I ordered the Dragon bowl.  I think mine definitely looked tastier.  In any case, they were all a pretty good portion and you will definitely feel full after.  Too bad because those Energy Balls they had for dessert looked really tempting.

Montreal's filled with beautiful people speaking a beautiful language, so after soundcheck at La Sala Rossa we decided to walk down St-Laurent, taking in the sites and possibly some dinner.  We spotted a VEGAN place across the street that looked real healthy and the clientele was nothing short of bonny, so we took a booth.  THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!!!  If yer touring through Montreal, you MUST eat here.   So many good things on the menu and they're all made with some serious love.  The wait staff is super pretty and nice too...   Giancarla had the Dragon Bowl and thought it was "excellent." She felt the cabbage and the carrots and the sauce that came with it were "so fresh" and not "vegetabl-ey."  She went on to say, "the dressing was real yummy and the rice on the bottom had some sort of sauce,...I didn't know what it was, but loved it anyway."  Sondre had the Buddha Bowl and states, "I come from this with a perspective of someone who's not a vegetarian or vegan, but I like exploring and I thought it looked like a great establishment and I was VERY impressed.  I'd say it was Ace. I felt very good about the meal and I'd never had tofu like that before.  [the tofu] Tasted so good.  And the healthy portion of broccoli is always a plus.  You know me, I'm not big on dressings and dips and all that shit, but this sauce was perfect.  The stuff on the rice was super good and I liked all those pumpkin seeds.  It felt like a full, hearty, and healthy meal."  As for me, I had the Thai Bowl and was real happy with all the carrots, those big stems of bok choy, the brown rice, the peanut sauce, and tofu, but I must say, If I were to do it all over again, I'd go with the Buddha Bowl.  I was so jealous of all that broccoli!  (Luckily, Sondre was kind enough to share)  The Bowls are definitely big enough to share or take half home for the van ride later, so keep that in mind when yer planning ahead to your post-show-midnight-meal.    All 3 of us got the fresh juices and were blown away. Sondre and Giancarla got the TONIC (Apple, Lemon, Ginger) which was super spicy and made them feel like it was immediately working on repairing the throat and boosting their sinus immunity.  A+!   I was elated to drink the (Apple, Carrot, Beet) juice cuz I know Beets are so good for me. Health...in a glass.  Sondre even went nuts an ordered a fancy green tea on top of all that (for his pipes).  He was in a decadent beverage heaven, of which, he'd make a solitary promise to re-visit as often as possible through the consumption of fresh and healthy juices around the country; or die trying.  (at least that's what his expression supposed)  We didn't have time to eat dessert, but I can't imagine it'd be anything less than "fett."  GO EAT HERE!!!!  ~Dave "Herremannen" Heilman

This is by far the best vegan restaurant I have ever been to. Not only is the food delicious and the menu varied but the environment is inviting and friendly.  The clientele is a nice mix of families and punks and hippies you would expect at a vegan place.  The menu is deep enough that it requires multiple visits!   It's in a great part of the city so if you haven't explored that neighborhood yet it's worth the trip.
Great vegan restaurant. Try the Popeye beverage with the pollenta dish.

Good food, fun atmosphere. We ordered a breakfast plate and a smoked coconut BLT (loved it!). Even though the portions are huge, my husband actually ate two of the breakfast platters, one right after the other, and really impressed the waitress.   We had to wait awhile to get a table, but the service was friendly (if not super fast) and bilingual. I remember the restaurant being kind of noisy, but I'm glad it's so popular.  I would definitely go to Aux Vivres again if visiting Montreal.

I live the food here... I even crave it. I always have the BLT on chapati and the dragon bowl with tofu. I have seen this restaurant go from a small business to a full blown money Nanking restaurant. The I Lu thing that bothers me is that they are constantly raisin their prices... The food used to be made fresh and seemed to be made with live and now it seems to be mass produced and the quality is going down a bit. I will continue to go there until either the price becomes unaffordable or when I just stop craving the food. But I definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone even non vegetarian people can eat here and learn how to eat tasty healthy foods.
They have very tasty fake cheesecake I always take their special of the day and it's always good. Very fast and good service
You really do not have to be vegan to enjoy this restaurant. They serve a delicious healthy brunch!

Astonishingly great!! The Dragon sauce with Dragon Tempeh bowl is so fresh & fantastic! I do enjoy a good steak once in a while but this food will make you feel like your glowing from the inside.  Delicious!!

J'ai découver Aux vivres lors de mon passage à Montréal en juin dernier. Je ne suis pas végétarienne mais une yelpeuse qui aime découvrir des nouveaux endroits (surtout quand on en dit que du bien!).  Ma moitié qui était avec moi voulait tout de même se mettre un morceau de viande sous la dent avant d'aller retrouver nos amis. Finalement c'est le ventre vide qu'il est arrivé Aux Vivres et qu'il en ressorti le ventre bien rempli et heureux d'avoir découvert une nouvelle cuisine.   Les desserts sont à tomber. Le faux-mage est juste extra et franchement, végétalien ou pas, il a un goût de vrai cheesecake (peut-être un peu plus consistant).  Le seul gros point négatif c'était la serveuse hardcore qui venaient toutes les 30 secondes nous demander si tout était ok. Si elle avait pu lécher la table, elle l'aurait fait! Elle était tellement limite qu'à la fin du repas, elle nous a sorti le couplet sur le pourboire en se mettant presque à genoux et cela, sans se douter qu'elle parlait à des personnes qui vivaient à MTL depuis plus d'un an.  Pas de réservation alors, arrivez tôt! Très tôt!

Ambiance très relaxe et sympathique!  C'est vraiment un bon endroit pour aller découvrir de nouvelles recettes originales végétariennes/vegan! La découverte qui m'a le plus épaté est le sandwich BLT à la noix de coco, vraiment délicieux et excellent mélange de saveurs! Définitivement un endroit à essayer pour tous!

Pretentious, boring, contradictory.    Their menu totes "freshest ingredients, giving priority to local and seasonal produce, to create surprising flavour combinations and unusual dishes that you won't find anywhere else."    This statement is a stretch by any means, I have been to many vegan and vegetarian restaurants, that have blown my mind with unique and innovative cooking. This is not one of them.   Tofu and tempeh burgers are a dime a dozen. As are asian fusion bowls but not with the hefty price tag of 13 to 15 dollars, for a veggy bowl.  What is local or seasonal about daikon, dulce or wakame?   Let's be honest about what this restaurant truly is; it does not cater to much of the vegan crowd, because most vegans wouldn't pay the inflated prices for things they could easily make at home.  Most vegans and vegetarians have had their share of tofu and tempeh burgers, if not a few hundred veggie bowls.   Therefore, lets truthfully admit that this restaurant caters to the curiosity of non vegan and vegetarians offering trendy fare at a price.   The staff were rather aloof, and had us standing at the host station for 10 minutes, while looking over a virtually empty restaurant. Furthermore when we were seated by who we thought to be our server, she said nothing to us and walked away from the table after seating. She then returned  with a bottle of water (for 3 of us)filling our glasses with water and walked away. 20 min later our glasses were empty and we were still waiting to order. When we finally made eye contact with one of the other employees behind the juice bar(who was leisurely chatting with other staff behind the bar), the original host/server finally came over and begrudgingly  took our order. After our food arrived our water glasses remained empty ( we think that they only allowed us one bottle of water because they expected us to buy drinks, such as $4.50 for 8oz of juice) and no one came to check on us to see if the food or order was to our satisfaction. To top it off the server had forgotten to bring a bowl of soup, but didn't realize.  Then another sever showed up at the table with soup in hand after we had already finished our meal.  After asking him to pack it to go, he returned with the bill and has the audacity to start chatting us up, almost as thought he was hoping to get a good tip. WTF?!  The food was satisfactory, but all in all the place left a bad taste in our mouths and a hole in our wallets.

We visited aux vivres three times in one week because we loved the food, concept, and service. This would have been a five star review however our first visit was a deal breaker. The hostess took our name and said it wouldn't be long. She took the names of three French speaking couples behind us and sat them before us. She even gave us a smug look as she was doing it. To the owner... so sorry for the one star but we are restaurant professionals who know blatant contempt when we see it. Not sure what her problem with us was other then that we did not speak French. We try to come to Montreal every summer so perhaps after our next visit, if your host staff treats us fairly, you'll get the five stars you deserve.  Update, looks like we're not going to get to Montreal this year. Here's the five stars you deserve. That hostest is probably long gone by now.
Best vegetarian restaurant in Montreal. Big portions, good price. It's not the classiest joint, but it's easy and the staff is friendly.
Ate here over the weekend, had the Le Complet, it was awesome.  Only gripes are that the service was too slow and their cheesecake was kinda vile.
Outstanding fresh, healthy food. The kind of meal you feel great after eating. Highly recommend for anyone seeking a salad or brown rice dish with a tasty sauce.

This was the first vegan restaurant in Montreal and I was super surprised to learn that it was the best food I tried during my weekend visit there! It has not only provided an example for other health/compassionate establishments, but it has kept up the pace as more competition appears in the vegan resto realm. Service was fabulous. Huge portions with beautifully displayed meals, a late brunch (score!), lots of protein (tempeh!) options, and delicious, DELICIOUS ingredients and bites. I wanted to eat here every day (and almost did). There are lots of options including juices, big salads, veggie bowls, and more. I had the blueberry pancakes and it even came with a chai latte. If you are vegan, or even open-minded, you MUST go here - you will not be disappointed.
Very good food, and smoothies! The pancakes for brunch and bowls for dinner are amazing! Deserts and especially cheese cake are awesome!

Love it! I have yet to try something here that I didn't like.   My personal favourite meal here is the mekong wrap with a creamsicle smoothie. Delicious. Corn bread with guac is a solid starter.   One thing I always find bizarre though, is that when ever I upgrade from bread to the chapati wrap, the wraps are in fact just made of pita. This has happened several times. Maybe I'm missing something, but I'm pretty sure that chapatis and pitas are not generally considered to be one and the same. Note to Aux Vivres chefs/menu-makers, if you are reading this: Miriam Webster defines 'chapati' as "a round flat unleavened bread of India that is usually made of whole wheat flour and cooked on a griddle". Just thought you should know.    The chana 'chapati' is also very good, though can get pretty soggy (again, this may be because it is in a pita, not a chapati).   Personally, I enjoy sitting at the counter (or anywhere on the lefthand side of this place), but hey, it's all good.

My first time in Mtl, and friend who lived here recommended this place. Went around noonish on a weekday and it was packed! It was just the two of us so no wait. Lovely, bright place, good service and lots of variety in the menu! We ordered the soup of the day, I think it was curry lentil, and I had the Mekong wrap/sandwich. Soup was delicious, full of flavour and not too runny, with a good consistency. The Mekong was HUGE! I got it with tempeh instead of tofu (first time trying it) and it was really good! All the flavours went really well together. Would definitely recommend it and would love to come back to try more of the menu!

Love that it's open late. Bombay Banane smoothy is the business. English and French menu. Slaw that comes with burgers is great and I don't even like slaw!  One less star because each item is at least $1.50 pricier than seems reasonable. However, I still make this a regular stop whenever I'm in Montreal.

I was only in Montreal a week, but went here twice! The food is very fresh, amazing, the portions are huge, and best of all, *everything* is vegan. The first time I went, I got the buddah bowl and nectar juice (apple, carrot and beet) and my boyfriend got the seitan sandwich and the creamsicle smoothie. Everything was soooooooo wonderful!  The second time, I got the la polenta brunch, which is fried polenta, black bean refritos, guacamole, salsa & salad. I also got a side of tofu scramble and espresso. The polenta was probably the best polenta I have had in my entire life. I don't know how they prepared and breaded it so perfectly. My boyfriend ordered the faux lox sanwich on chapati bread and a cafe frappe. All of that was delicious. My boyfriend also got soup, which wasn't memorable. We also shared cheesecake, which was excellent. We always have to take advantage of vegan desserts.   The prices are well worth it for what you get.  To those who complained about the service, maybe you should stay in America. I recommend Red Robin, where they're up your a-- every 5 minutes.
La bouffe est plutôt bonne.  Pourquoi deux étoiles ? - Pas d'alcool. - Des mouches partout.

My friends and I are vegetarians that enjoy trying interesting vegan fare. We ordered a Thai bowl, Mexicali plate and the Dragon Wrap. The wrap was rather bland and tasted very raw, but the Thai bowl and Mexicali plate were flavorful and filling. The atmosphere inside the restaurant didn't seem that nice, but we ate outdoors in the back patio area which was very cute and relaxing. The menu is offered in both English and French, which turned out well for us since we don't know a lick of French. Overall an enjoyable meal!

I'm not vegan, nor a vegetarian, but I love me some Aux Vivres.   I find it really difficult to find restaurants that give you large quantities of cooked leafy greens in Montreal, unless we're talking about Chinese food. But Aux Vivres does just that in their rice bowls, particularly the Thai and Macro options.   I make it a point to have a meal here every time I'm in Montreal. I initially came for the chapati wrapped sandwiches (especially the CLT, duh!), but since finding out about a gluten intolerance, I also really appreciate that Aux Vivres makes it very clear which items are g-free on their menu.   Went for lunch on a Friday afternoon. I ordered the Thai bowl with smoked coconut on the side. My boyfriend ordered the Sirocco and a salad. The food came quickly, the service was great, and we didn't feel rushed. The dressings and sauces were very unique and tasty... and I liked the light marinade they used on my tofu.   I keep on wanting to try their desserts, but I just keep on getting too full from my main dishes! Until next time, Aux Vivres!

We are in town from Virginia for a few nights, traveling with our 3 kids, ages 12, 9, and 4. My husband and I are vegetarians, but our kids love meat whenever possible. We decided upon this cute little vegan spot based on reviews and proximity to our VRBO condo. It didn't disappoint.   We ordered gyro, Portabello burger, a Thai tofu bowl special, chili, cornbread, and humus. Ingredients were fresh. Portions huge. Nobody left hungry, but we all felt healthy. Our 9 year old couldn't believe there was no meat in his chili (and he loved it!)  Highly recommended for healthy, tasty, family-friendly meal.

Nice vegan fast food-style restaurant. It was very busy but we got a table right away and the service was friendly and quick. I had the portobello burger, which was very nice. I was maybe a bit disappointed because I had expected an actual burger but it was really just a portobello mushroom on bread. The potato wedges and accompanying salad were delicious. My partner liked her assiette Kosmos. The only downside was that it was very loud in the restaurant (including the music), which didn't make for the most relaxing meal.

The food is delish. It is rare to find good vegetarian/vegan food and this place served it up for sure. Although I have noticed the prices sneaking up of late the food is still worth it.  And yes the coconut bacon BLT Wrap with vegan mayo IS that good.  There hasn't been anything ordered that I didn't enjoy, and that includes the bites I have stolen off of my friend's plates :) kudos to the cooks.  I recommend: Veggiepâté Chili BLT wrap Buddah Bowl the Soupe du Jour is usually bangin' the Brownies are yum and so is the Chocolate/banana Pie  Staff is bilingual which is bonus and they accept cash/debit and CC.   Downside? Holy lineups Batman!   To be fair the first few times weren't too bad and the staff were friendly, however last time we waited for almost an hour to be seated (no exaggeration). Granted we were a group of  7, not as easy to seat, but I feel that with better seating management and planning this could have been avoided. People with only 2 or 3 were constantly given priority over us and then there was a couple who walked right by the line of about 15 people, went up to the hostess whom they obviously knew, and were immediately seated at a table that was just cleared. When we were seated they tried to fit us at a 4-seater table even though the table next to us was free. So we pulled it over and made it work, which noticeably pissed the waitress off and would explain the extra slow service and attitude we got that night.  As soon as we got our food though all was forgiven... or at least forgotten :)   And yes I do plan on returning, several times, although I will probably avoid going in a larger group and Thurs-Sat evenings. Or evenings period. Come to think of it take out is prob best.

I've lived here about a year and this place is so far my favourite Montreal food - and I'm not vegan.   You can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches but my faves are the Mekong and the BLT (with roasted coconut as a bacon replacement - YUM).  Also the chocolate cake is to die for.    Service-wise very good and fast.  They are especially great about keeping water cups filled and replenishing you table pitcher of water.  I love that they have a separate side for to-go orders too, so the two are not competing service wise.

I was told ahead of time that Aux Vivres was the first and is still the most popular vegan restaurant in Montreal. Being vegetarian, I had to try it!   I was not disappointed. The place is fairly easy to get to and there are enough options to suit even the pickiest eater. The place was packed (with silly hipsters) when I got there. Unfortunately I didn't get to eat much, but I did get the chilli, and it was delicious! The drinks looked really good, and a lot of people near me were getting dessert, but I was already full...next time. Also, the staff are really nice here. Definitely try it out if you want quality comfort food.

The day they started selling dragon sauce in a bottle is the day I expressed my joy in song: 'O Happy Day'!!!  When start to run out of dragon sauce at home, my head starts to hurt... And the faux-mage cheesecake? Heaven on a fork!!  I will go to this restaurant again, and again, and again, and again...

Terrible service and totally unoriganized. The waitress was randomly pick customer to serve instead of seating customer in order. The food is very average, but i guess there is really not much vegan places in Montreal.
Uninspired overpriced vegan food. I cannot believe they got rid of the rye bread. RIP rye bread

This post will be like most other on here, I'm going to sing the praises of the aux vivres BLT, it's simply the best sandwich I've ever had. I will say that I have almost perfect this sandwich myself all that's off is the chapatti bread, I can't seem to make it the same way. The coconut bacon, has a smokey, sweet and salty flavour, as well as a slightly greasy aspect to it because of the fat in coconut. The secret to that sandwich is the vegan butter sauce that they spread on the chapatti before applying the vegan mayo, Bacon, lettuce and tomato.    I've also tried there new breakfast burrito, it's great, a generous portion plus a coffee or tea for 5$. Other items I've had include, the portobello burger, the channa wrap, veggie lox, the veggie pate, chilli, faux cheese cake, choco banana pie, many smoothies and fresh juices.    I've been here 20+ times in the past 3-4 years, I've never had a bad meal, the only thing I hate about going to aux vivres is when my meal comes to an end, I just never want to leave.   I've been a vegetarian for about 8 years and   I'm trying to be a vegan, this restaurant makes it that much easier.

I really enjoyed my meal!! And the service!!  The server was so kind, and informative. He wasn't vegan but had amazing suggestions for my non vegan friends.  The burgers were all delicious!!! I was very impressed!! Can't wait to go back!!
Great vegan food, good service. I liked the soup du jour.  For true vegans, this is a real find, so I give it 5 stars.
Excellent restaurant végétarien. J'y retournerais volontiers.  Le service était adéquat et accueillant. Un repas santé avec de bonnes proportions. J'ai hâte d'y essayer d'autres plats.

Sans doute l'un des meilleurs restaurants pour se familiariser à la cuisine végétalienne (aucun produit ou sous-produit animal). Aux vivres propose un riche menu coloré et inspiré de plusieurs cultures du monde (Mexique, Inde, Liban, Thaïlande, etc.) Ceux qui croient encore au mythe que la cuisine végétalienne n'est point bourrative, venez faire un tour ici; le personnel décontracté vous servira des portions toutes autant généreuses qu'inventives.  En entrée, je vous conseille le dahl; il est particulièrement réussi. Ça se corse lorsque vient le temps de choisir son repas principal. C'est qu'on hésite surtout entre les « Bols » ou les Burgers. Les bols sont des ramassis de nature, accompagnés d'une sauce. Le bol thaï est un franc délice : bok choi à la vapeur, carottes et daïkons marinés, coriandre avec une addictive sauce aux arachides. Le tout est servi sur du riz brun avec du tofu grillé. Je ne suis pas trop fan de tofu, mais j'ai bien aimé celui-là!.. Surprise!  C'est un grand restaurant doté, imaginez-vous, d'un large bar à jus!... Essayez le Creamsicle, un mélange parfait de lait de coco, jus d'orange, de carotte, vanille et sucre bio... Le tonique est assez efficace aussi : pomme, citron, gingembre. Simple et bon. Pour le bonheur de caféïnomanes, du véritable café équitable est offert ( allant du filtre jusqu'au frappé au lait de soya). Sans oublier l'immanquable Kombucha, presque devenu un symbole tendances de bien-être au naturel. Au moins, ça ne fait de mal à personne...  - Parmi les oeuvres d'art affichées sur les murs (elles sont à vendre), l'on y retrouve une magnifique toile de hiboux...

I've been here around ten times by now. Every time I have been blown away but the quality of the food (service sometimes leaves a little to be desired, but they do their best). Get the dragon bowl... It's like the vegan answer to Mac and cheese.

This is a delicious restaurant. Whatever-tarian you are, you will ENJOY this restaurant... The food just TASTE AMAZING.   What I like about Aux Vivres:  - Delicious, fresh and creative menu - Good smoothies - Beautiful presentation - Reasonable prices - Veggies, veggies, veggies!!! - Real good portions - It is always crowded (more people in there=more healthy people!) - Colors, health and quality!!!   What I like less:  - The "plain" service (it's fine, it's just not super friendly) - Could be hard to park if you have a car.  /////////////////////////   I am in love with the "Deluxe" salad... And, must try the brunch on week-ends; the polenta is yummmmy!   THANK YOU Aux Vivres!!! :)

I love this place! It has become a superb must for me on the regular. They make the most delicious & refreshing food and drinks- it's unbeatable for breakfast, brunch....yum!!!!!!!!!!!! go here now!!!!

J'ai pris Los Huevos Rancheros. Je m'attendais à être déçue puisque je suis Mexicaine et je connais le vrai goût de ce met, mais à ma grande surprise, j'ai adoré mon repas. Les haricots avaient bon goût et gros bravo pour leur tortillas de maïs, elles étaient très bonnes, elles ne goûtaient pas le conservateur, une des meilleures tortillas que j'ai mangées à Montréal. Le prix est très abordable et c'est sur que je reviens!

Fantastic dragon bowl! So happy to have fresh, flavorful and healthy food after two weeks of indulging on vacation. It was so good it still felt indulgent! Great spot for vegetarians or anyone wanting to have a good for you meal in Montreal.
Fast, friendly and fresh. Creative and really well executed menu and nice staff. Worth the trip from anywhere.

The food is great! Get one of the sandwichs on chapati and take the second half home for lunch the next day. They are that big. Servers can be brusk with all the tables but are often cute. Always nice art on the walls.

The first time i came in i had a most delicious greek grynos but the next time i came in their veggie burger option with fries was a disappointment-too spicy and i got a soso waiter. The meal with tip-in the end is too pricey. I remember when this restaurant was a hole i the wall and much more humane on a side street at another location now its a yuppified diner. Its hit or miss with this one.

This place wasn't as good as I heard it was. We had a tempeh burger, which was okay at best. Not very flavorful or exciting, and the bun tasted stale or gluten-free. The potatoes that came with it weren't very tasty either. The Mumbai thali was better -- the dressing on the salad was delicious. Overall slightly disappointed.

Went three times in three days during our Montreal stay. Lively, friendly atmosphere in a good location. If you're vegan, AV has everything you could want. All dishes are generous and tasty. Smoothies, tea, apps, mains. The polenta plate at brunch is stellar, as are the burgers/wraps. We also loved the mezze dip app. The tzatziki is well-made, as are the potatoes. You can't go wrong. AV presents and constructs solid, nutritious and delicious food. We learned about the shop/take-out side the day we left -- they do a great job there, too.

Staff are calm, attentive and not over bearing. Food was fast but it was just a salad so cannot judge. The Dragon Salad was delicious! $12. Brown rice was tasty and a good soy and sesame vinaigrette but I was left a little hungry ( just a bit more vegetables) and the grilled tofu could of been marinated for flavour or seasoned and cooked more than the mere scorch line it bore. Overall a great spot for a Sunday light supper that seems to attract all ilk.
One of my favorite vegan place in Montreal.. Big menu with a lot of options!! The BLT wrap is sooo good!!! If you are for the brunch...try Los Huevos Rancheros.
Prices double every year. I miss the old pre-macdonalized aux vivres. Still good dragon bowl if in a pinch but not what it was.

Hier j'ai eu une envie soudaine de boire un bon jus frais. Ayant déjà entendu parler des jus Aux Vivres, j'ai convaincu mon chum de faire un détour pour aller m'en chercher un. J'ai pris le Popaye. Un bon jus vert pleins de vitamine !! Miammmmmmm...ce fût un délice dans ma bouche :-) J'y retourne c'est sûr pour essayer la nourriture la prochaine fois !! J'ai entendu dire que le bol du dragon est à essayer absolument car la sauce dragon est plus que délicieuse.
Même si je suis une carnivore, j'adore passer à ce resto pour les jours où je n'ai pas envie de manger de viande.   Je vous suggère fortement le burger de Tempeh!

Food was excellent but the service was very slow. I went for brunch on a Sunday and was able to sit down pretty quickly. First course came out fast. We ordered food to go when we ordered our breakfast, but waited an excessively long period of time to get our to go order, and then waited even longer to get our check. But the staff was extremely friendly and the prices were very reasonable considering the large portions given.

No soy vegetariana y sin embargo este es uno de mis restaurantes favoritos para una comida informal en el Plateau. Después de haberlos probado todos, los mejores boles son, en mi opinión, el "Thai" y el "Buddha". Los sándwiches no me acaban de convencer; algunos son demasiado secos. La hamburguesa de la casa, eso sí, está buenísima, y es una alternativa algo más ligera a la de ternera.   Tienen una buena variedad de zumos sanos y refrescantes y los postres están ricos, aunque un bol suele saciar el hambre. No obstante, si la sopa del día es la "Dhal" de lentejas, siempre le hago un hueco porque es mi favorita.   El servicio es muy agradable  y el espacio es amplio y alegre, además siempre está lleno de gente y abre hasta las once de la noche. También hay una tienda dentro en la cual se venden algunos de sus productos y se recogen los pedidos para llevar.
Great food if you're looking for mostly fast food vegan. They offer a variety of options, everyone is sure to be satisfied and not left hungry. Meat lovers approve!

No visit to Montreal, historically, has been complete for me without a visit to Aux Vivres. While a bit of a challenge to find the first time I trekked up that way, it remains probably my favourite Montreal vegan restaurant. On my most recent visit in town for Pycon, I managed to get here twice. Looking forward to my favourites, the Montreal Smoked Meat Sandwich (where else can you get a good vegan version?), and the delicious brunch waffles.  ALAS! Neither remain on the menu. Instead, on visit one, I had their gyro, splitting an order of chili fries with my dining pals. The gyro was great, made cool and tasty by the tzaziki. The chili fries were a little so-so - about 10 wedges, on a bed of chili, topped with sour cream.  The second visit was a bit disappointing. I branched out into trying the Dragon Wrap, with a side of sauerkraut. The calling card of this dish, I assume, is the "Dragon Sauce", which is best described as "orange". It was maybe a bit like French salad dressing. I don't know. All in all not too impressive a sandwich, and I had some serious FOMO towards the BLT that a dining pal was eating, and the gyro that my ghost data from the day before was eating.  Topped it off with a coco-cashew cream pie, which was actually pretty excellent, and turned it into a pretty positive experience overall.  Still, do I yearn for you, O Montreal Smoked Vegan Meat Sandwich. Maybe I'll try making one at home. I really had my heart set on it.

On Sunday, after working up an appetite at the Lindy Hop workshops and just before leaving Montreal and heading back to Toronto, we had dinner at a vegan restaurant called Aux Vivres.... Read the rest of the review:  http://alltheveganthings.com/post/16444279031/vegan-dining-restaurants-review-montreal-aux-vivres#.Tx9u57ytM6w

Trekked in the snow just try out this renown Montreal vegetarian restaurant, definitely worth it! Food was delicious and well priced. I had the kosmos plate which curved all my cravings, and first time trying tempeh was so yummy! Both me and my friend was amazed by the rich, smooth chocolate apple cake, and was even more so when finding out that the secret ingredient was zucchini. Definitely recommend everyone to try, vegan or not

it was my first time at any vegan restaurant and it was a great experience. even though I am a meat lover , the bowl I took (dragon bowl) had great flavors and taste. It was pretty big and filling , I had trouble finishing it

I have had the brunch, lunch and supper numerous times. Every time the food is scrumptious and so filling! The service is generally good, unless it is jam packed. The place fills up quickly for suppertime and if you are a group of 4 or more, be prepared to wait as they do not take reservations.  I am allergic to dairy and being able to have some non-dairy whipped cream on my waffles make me happy camper.

Generous portion, reasonable price and fresh ingredients. I had the buddha bowl (with tofu), which came in a large colorful bowl of veggies and rice.My only small complaint is that I wish he proportion of rice to veggies was more equal, as there was way too much rice and not enough veggies to balance it. However, the sauce was very good and complemented the meal well.    The price point was very reasonable. $11 for the sandwiches and $13-15 for the bowls. I wish i had the room to try their desserts as they looked so so good. Will definitely return to try the sandwiches and chocolate desserts !    P.S. Their menu is extremely extensive, so great place for non-vegan/vegetarians as well.
Love it here! Polenta brunch with beans and tofu scramble. The guacamole is awesome.  Vegan brunch goodness galore!
Indifferent to neglectful service on a Friday night. The food was good once it finally came, but we considered eating our fingers in the interim.
Un des mes restaurants favoris à Montréal (et je suis même pas vegan)! Essayez le gâteau faux-mage! Superbe!

Go there. If you are reading Yelp and wonder where to go, just go there. It means you either want to discover something new or want a safe choice. Either way, go there. This is the type of place that you simply have to know. Nope, I have nothing to recommend. Veggie food with awesome taste. I give it 5 stars for the price.

We both had burgers with fries, and were disappointed by the meal. The patty and bread were dry and thin, the bare garnish (one thin slice of tomato and lettuce) had been over-refrigerated (?), and the potato wedges were uninteresting and had a granule texture. Service was mediocre, food was lacklustre, and way over priced for what it was. Not worth it by any measure. People must come here to play into a certain image of themselves because this food is not good.

A must visit whenever I'm back in Montreal. I first tried it back in the day when Aux Vivres was still a dank closet with staff with dreadlocks down to their waist and a strong scent of patchouli in the air. They used to have a standard brunch for $11.  Then, the tides mysteriously changed and it renovated to the current look and menu. I think a lot of hipster Montrealers took this as a betrayal to the restos' hippie roots and always refuse to go here. I used to adopt the same stance until I tried the deluxe salad, creamsicle smoothie and coconut laced BLT (which tastes far less burnt than it used to).  It gets pricey but its good if you want something light. And as a former vegetarian, it's a just try for a menu that you don't have to worry about.  Slow service and can get packed in the evening. Decent patio.

I like Aux Vivres, but I think it needs to challenge itself a bit and improve it's food. Vegan food does not have to be just "good for vegan food".   Having lived in Portland, Oregon, I've had some amazing meals in vegan restaurants. I understand that the vegan culture in Portland is way more prevalent leading to more competition and therefore leading to restaurants having to challenge themselves and make the best tasting and more creative options on their menus. I think what Aux Vivres lacks is that healthy competition in the city.  I had the Aux Vivres burger for my main. The patty itself was good, although the consistency was a bit dry and crumbly. the potato wedges it came with lacked taste and were not prepared properly. they were not crispy at all. I only ate three.   The dessert I had was the Chipotle brownie and it was definitely delicious!   So, quick conclusion: great try, first of its kind in Montreal, obviously there is a large market for this kind of restaurant considering how there are consistently line-ups to get a table.   Perhaps a little bit of competition in the city would make them "up" their game a bit.
It's so good, we ate there twice on a three night trip and I wish we went three or more! The food is exceptionally delicious and fairly priced. I can't wait to go back for the uncheesecake alone!

Up until recently, I had only ever had takeout from Aux Vivres. Which is fine for me and my lazy-arse homies, aside from the fact that when it did reach our plates, it wasn't all that warm (i.e. it was cold *heavy sigh*). As a result of these experiences, however delicious, I may have initially given this place 3 or 4 stars. Luckily for me and the Yelpers who are reading this, I managed to get my booty to the establishment last week, and what a gem this place is! Pretty cute place I have to say, with equally cute employers. I'm pretty sure I'm allowed to throw that in there, but really you should all be checking out this vegan hotspot for its, ahem, food. My friend and I split the Aux Vivres burger and Mekong wrap, which equalled glorious choices on our parts. In the past, I've had the Dragon and Thai bowls, and oh man....even when made 45-60 minutes earlier (thanks SLOW delivery service!), they were still brilliant dishes.   To end this lil review, I will most definitely return to delight in more vegan cuisine. After all, I love healthy food and this food will make you feel good. What will also make you feel good is oogling the nice looking staff that work there - unless you get caught. Then, you're just creepy like me.

Always busy...even on Monday nights! A sign that there is not enough vegan restaurant in Montreal...  Vegan fares that will make you come back for more...not all dishes are a hit in my opinion but some are highly addictive!   Try the pate samples with chapati or the dragon bowl. The vege lox is quite surprising, it does really taste like smoke salmon!   Delicious smoothies and fresh juices! Friendly service. That's all you need to know!

I have nothing but praise for my favourite little vegan hotspot on the Plateau - and Aux Vivres should not disappoint a grumbling (and earth-friendly) appetite. Their ingredients are super fresh, and I mean "crunchy" fresh. Salads are great. Also tried their pizza, which was served semi-warm but delicious nonetheless.. sometimes it's hard to believe they can substitute animal ingredients out and still be hearty - but they deliver. A+
Aside from getting PICKPOCKETED and having $120 and an iPhone STOLEN, the food was terrific; just watch your belongings!

Here I go, my first review on Yelp.  Let me start of by saying that I have never bought any of the items from Aux Vivres but I have gladly munched on many items that my girlfriend has gotten from there.  As a non vegan, I would not have paid the money for these items. But as of 11:35pm on a Tuesday night, I have officially changed my mind. Everything that I have eaten from this establishment has been superb! With the exception of the faux egg and bacon brunch plate. That one was a bit of a let down, rather bland if I may say so myself. But everything else has been so on point that I am thinking that perhaps I should try out vegan-ism. I would like to throw out a big shout out to whomever came up with these delicious recipes. Especially the guy that came up with the vegan BLT and the chipotle brownie. I cannot express how satisfied I am with those two items. If i could, I would like to shake hands with the creators.   Bravo Aux Vivres, never did I think I would be writing this review. Hopefully you guys can sprout amazing locations like this throughout North America. But until then my allegiance lies to Montreal for the best Vegan food!

Ok, I'm addicted to the Vege Pate. I had to run over to their take-out shop next door and buy some for home.  Aux Vivres was one of the best meals I had in Montreal. Everything is vegan and perfectly executed.  I had the dragon bowl because I wanted to try this dragon sauce that  I have heard so much about.  It was creamy, nutty, rich, and soooo good.  The bowl was so big I couldn't finish it!  Beets, carrot, red cabbage, daikon, lettuce, sprouts, and in-house made tempeh ($13.50).  As for fresh juices, the Popeye (5.95/7.50) was a magical spicy blend of cucumber, celery, apple, lemon, cayenne pepper.  I'm totally coming back here next time I'm in town!

Also so good, healthky, full of colors, and so delicious! Always have tontake the dragon bowl (12$) worth alll the penny.  The restaurant is now twice space as it was. Veryconfortable, sunny seats and banquette. No wifi  Also the boutique allows us to bring back good food at jome. All vegan, all flavourful - so many things to try. The cakes can be brought home for a birthday or party. The smoothie has a perfect snack. But try to take away just one thing. Everything is so appealing

Définitivement mon restau préféré  a Montreal ! Preuve que végétalisme ne rime pas avec monotonie ! C'est bon ,goûteux et sain ! Ma préférence va au bol Thaï mais J aime Le dahl de lentilles corail,  le bol dragon, les sandwichs. Adresse incontournable de Montreal !

Je ne suis pas végé, mais si je pouvais manger aux vivres à tous les jours, je le deviendrais sans hésiter!! J'ai gouté à la salade Deluxe, dans laquelle il y avait du tofu grillé et végélox, c'était trop bon! J'ai aussi pris le wrap aux aubergines, IMMENSE et excellent! Évidemment nous avons partagé ces deux assiettes et c'etait parfait. J'y retournerai tres bientot!!

We loved Aux Vivres! The Caesar salad, mixed dip platter, and the potato wedges with chipotle mayo were all so flavorful and fresh. We wish we lived in Montreal so we could go back regularly. THAT CASHEW CHEESE!
Always packed. It's better to order takeout. for vegan food (which usually tastes like cardboard) it's excellent. I recommend the dragon bowl with Tempe.

Good vegan food!  I am happy there is an all vegan restaurant in Montreal. Au Vivre has a good size menu, the huevos rancheros for the weekend brunch menu are so good. Good coffee as well and great combinations for fresh juices, the popeye is green power and delicious.  They also offer cakes and desserts, I am excited to try some f those.  The restaurant itself has a diner feeling to it.  Nothing special.  The service is good and fast. Prices are reasonable.  Overall, a good vegan option!

Aux vivres est LE resto santé par excellence.  Tout y est Végétalien! Il y a des salades, des burgers avec galette jardinière ( un style de pâté aux légumes) , des sandwichs en wrap, des smoothie décadent avec lait de coco ( MIAM ), des thés bios - tous cela et plus sans gluten, sans soya et sans noix . Le truc qui saute de l'ordinaire aux vivres ce sont leurs ''bols'' , un assortiment de légumes avec tofu grillés et riz bruns. Pour cette fois-ci,  j'essaie juste une entrée, le pain de maÏs servis avec Guacamole . La portion , que je trouve à première vue un peu petite , est toute fois un satisfaisante et à un goût succulent. C'est surtout le Guacamole qui me charme, il faut dire que j'ai un penchant fort pour l'avocat , donc en servis en purée avec un goût un peu citronné est une concoction parfaite à mes yeux. Le pain de maÏs est épais mais moelleux et a un goût délicieux avec ou sans la guacamole. Comme boisson, j'opte pour le Smoothie Lassi à la mangue qui est fait de mangue, lait de coco et lime avec une texture velouté et pas trop sucré - c'est idéal !  L'ambiance et la déco me rappel un resto des années 50 plus moderne, style 50's diner bar avec des petites banquettes aux sièges rouges et j'aime bien la terrasse qu'on retrouve tout au fond.   J'y retournerais pour essayer d'autres mets sur le menu notamment un burger portobello ( fanatique de champignons) et un des fameux bols.  Le sil hic est que je trouve le tout un peu dispendieux, j'ai payé 15$ ( pourboire inclus) juste pour une entrée et une boisson.  Certains diront que je suis trop lésineuse et Je sais très bien que les restos végé sont souvent plus dispendieux à cause des aliments bios qu'ils utilisent dans leurs plats mais sa serait appréciable de pouvoir déguster des mets santé à un prix un peu plus raisonnable et sa inciterait plus de gens à vouloir essayer!

So a few years have passed and I think it's time for an update! Food, as usual, is delicious. Lots and lots of fresh veggies. Good flavours. Lots of choice. And service is excellent! Not sure if its the newfangled tablets the servers use to take orders, but everything went a lot more smoothly and quickly than in the past. And our waitress was so kind, checking in with us on a regular basis, and even chatting a bit about our days.

This is an EXCELLENT vegan restaurant. I'm a huge meat fan but I know it isn't good for me or the environment, but I can't help loving what I love (mmkay?)  I came here, ate the dragon bowl and LOVED IT. It was so delicious, satisfying and not at all "vegan" which you would think would not fill you up but it was so good.   I am definitely re-energized to become a vegan / vegetarian again. That dragon sauce is killer. Delicious. DELICIOUS. I want to eat everything on the menu now.

Great vegan food. They have gluten free options. I've been two or three times (it's a little pricey, but worth it). I've tasted the Dragon bowl (my favorite), tempeh burger (good), and the vegan BLT (good but you must like coconut).   I would recommend it and I look forward to going back!

If you're looking for delicious and affordable vegan cuisine, this is my number one pick in the city. They recently expanded, due to the constant flow of people, which has really helped minimize lineups. The food is fantastic and offers a mix of Indian, Greek, Thai, Mexican and other inspired flavours - but all with the Aux Vivres twist.   My usuals here are the curry lentil soup, the Thai & Dragon bowls with tempeh, the Thai choupati wrap and of course one of their fabulous desserts, notably the GF banana-chocolate torte or the apple-chocolate cake. Yum!

Very good restaurant. Nice, hip, yet friendly ambiance which is tough to pull off. Food is healthy and extremely tasty. We had a girl put together an awesome tasting menu for us with what in her opinion were the essentials which included: The Dragon Bowl (tempeh), Vivant Salad (tempeh), and my favorite this plate with an assortment of dips called the 'Mezzé Aux Vivres'. Was great. I went with Amanda, my girlfriend who wants to be included in this review. She thinks i was rude to the waitress but I wasnt.

Everything i've tried here is amazing. Their desserts, their food, the teas, the juices, all of it yummy. The prices are reasonable and the staff always friendly. One of the best vegetarian spots in Mtl

Je ne peux m'y prononcer que pour les plats à emporter, mais je peux déjà donner mon avis et vous encourager à vous y rendre et déguster par vous-mêmes les plats qui y sont concoctés! Si vous avez des préjugés sur la bouffe végétariens, je vous encourage à faire face à vos propres opinions et à vous ouvrir l'esprit en faisant vous-mêmes l'expérience de ce restaurant! Vous verrez que la cuisine végan ne se résume pas qu'à de la salade verte et des pois germés!  Rien qu'en consultant leur menu, vous constaterez que le choix est large et les plats originaux.

Je vais aux Vivres quand mon frère et sa blonde viennent en Ville car je ne suis pas Vegan moi-même.  La bouffe est bien présentée, délicieuse, fraîche et invitante pour ceux qui ne s'y connaissent pas ou craignent de ne pas aimer les alternatives a la viande. Le comptoir pour emporter est invitant. Les smoothies et les desserts semblent alléchants.    Je trouve par contre que c'est relativement dispendieux pour ce que c'est... et il y a vraiment toujours beaucoup de monde, ce qui rend le service plus ou moins agréable.

Although I'm not the prototypical client of Aux Vivres, I can certainly appreciate good vegan food and this place offers it up in spades.   I usually have the Dragon Bowl with grilled tempeh or the Sirocco sandwich. Both I think are great options for someone not necessarily used to eating this kind of cuisine. Tasty, fresh and healthy, what more does a body need? Maybe a smoothie to wash it down. I personally love mangoes so I recommend the Lassi À La Mangue.  It also makes a great meal when you're working late as its not heavy at all and leaves you energized. Maybe all employers should start feeding us Aux Vivres?  Bon appetit!

Some years back, I got the pleasure of visiting Aux Vivres. The ambience was wonderful and hip (do people use that word any more?). It wasn't too busy for a Saturday night, and it wasn't too cramped even for our big group. Although I was immersed in a French country, the English menu and atmosphere made me feel like I was back home again (The US).   Afree going over the menu extensively, I ordered the Thai Bowl with Grilled Tempeh. I am not sure (nor was I able to put my finger on it) but I wasn't "wowed" by it. I still enjoyed it especially once the dressing was smothered on every delicate green and orange veggie, but if I ever get another chance to visit again, I am gonna try something else. My other "amis" (aka friends) really enjoyed their cuisine, so I guess I was the only one that thought my dish was "just okay"  - The ambience and location gets a 5 - My dish gets a 4  I say it's still worth checking out, so if you are ever in town, head over there and bon apetite!

I live in San Francisco and we are spoiled with vegan cuisine there so I was excited to try Montréal's 1st vegan restaurant! I brought an omnivore friend who lives here for Sunday brunch and we shared the Tempeh Satay, Hercules Salad w/Tofu & Huevos Rancheros. We each tried two juices. Then we had our own desserts (I'm gluten-free):  carrot cake for him and chocolate banana pie for me. The meal was wonderful. It was Frank's 1st time having tempeh so I was happy to find out your artisan tempeh was made locally.  I loved the tzatziki that came with the salad (I'm Greek!). So creamy!  The desserts were amazing!  So happy I tried you all out.  Highly recommended for casual dining.

Holy Crap. This place a wonderful. I am the type of person who tries to eat at as many different places as possible. When I travel, I try not to waste precious stomach space on the same place twice. BUT this place is SO AWESOME. I ate here 3 out of the 4 days I hung out in Montreal. Their food is AMAZING! I am one who is not easily fooled by so called 'healthy' desserts, however, their desserts while healthy are delicious as well! The only item I am critical of are their shakes and smoothies. Mmmmm... Dragon bowls. Don't miss out on their Veggie Lox

This review may not reflect the quality of the food since this was my first vegan experience as a non vegan. Therefore It only helps compare vegan with non vegan food and from my taste view! I had the BLT and it was a recommendation of a vegan friend who had enjoyed it already. Did not like it!  They make coconut bacon which is neither. A semi sweet sandwich which is closer in essence to dessert than to main course. It also is pricy i say comparatively. Staff were nice and service was quite fast though.

Incontournable de la cuisine végétarienne à Montréal!! Très belle introduction à ce type de cuisine!  J'adore le bol du dragon avec du tempeh et leur pain au mais qui succulent avec leur gacamole !  Dernier favori le jus tonique vous donne un bon coup de fouet !!  J'ai même réussi à convertir mon mari a manger plus souvent végétarien grâce à leur plat!  Ambiance sans prétention mais très chaleureuse! Très bon service! À essayer!

Finally made it to Aux Vivres after hearing the hype for many years...and it does live up to its reputation. There were about 7 choices on the menu that could have been my #1 choice but I went with the chili fries with sour "cream" ... tasted like the real thing but no bad side effects from dairy afterward. A big win in my books. I hope they'll start stocking their sour cream in the store soon so I can bring some home and have it with pierogies.  Serving sizes were pretty large so if you have an appy or a juice, you might have to take home half your roti sandwich for lunch the next day.   The food came very quickly and our server was very pleasant.  Next visit: dragon bowl or buddha bowl, creamsicle smoothie, maybe the potato/chickpea curry roti or "lox" sandwich... Oh, man. There are going to have to be many next visits to fit all these in to my belly!

Aux Vivres has some great portions spread out over a varied menu. My personal faves are the dragon bowl - a huge heaping pile of veggies and brown rice, the various sandwiches and the saturday-sunday brunch.  Some deserts are awesome (the brownies, the cookies), some - not so much (the pies - which can be a bit bland and served as small portions).   Everything on the menu is about $2 more than I feel good paying, but it's a clean place with some delicious stand-outs.

I don't eat here very often because my boyfriend is allergic to soy and nuts (I know, I know -- poor me :( ) BUT when I do come to Aux Vivres I milk it for what it's worth.   First, what I like about Aux Vivres is that the staff is always very welcoming and friendly, the establishment is always clean, and they have booths (a.k.a privacy). You always see a mixture of people from stay-at-home moms in Lululemons, hipsters, tourists, yogis, business people that work in the hood, etc. so it's wonderful for people watching while you're waiting for your meal (in the privacy of your booth, obviously...)   Recommended dishes (and drinks): Bombay Banane smoothie (I swear that I hear the voice of angels singing when this drink is brought to me), corn bread and the Dragon Bowl with tempeh (mmm..). The brunch is always solid -- le complet is delicious - to reduce the soy intake, I like to have palenta rather than scrambled tofu for an additional 2$ - and the pancakes are tasty and filling (order with appetite).  Also! According to my friends who love Aux Vivres as much as I do, the BLT sandwich and the carrot cake come STRONGLY recommended for all you fat vegans/vegetarians/omnivores out there.   My only complaint about Aux Vivres is that it's always busy and you may have to wait for seating ;) Enjoy!

We were starving and in a hurry, so found this place quickly on urban spoon and glad we did. Great menu to choose from, we went with a Buddha bowl and a dragon sandwich, or was it the other way around?! Cornbread to start with and the dip was superb. Really light and fluffy bread. I had a chocolate shake, really thick and rich but not too much. We bought two corn breads and an apple crumble to take home! Yummy when toasted and reheated later.  My small dislikes were the incredibly squished in tables - we couldn't get up to use the washroom with asking our neighbours to move their tables.

At a convention in Montreal and needed real food. The choices were overwheleming and as an all Vegan rest I was giddy! Ended up going back the second nigth too. The Tempeh Burger was great and tasty, the portabella burger was amazing too.   Carrot juice brought life back into my soul. I am grateful for place like this when I travel. Helps me survive the madness. Staff was great and service was perfect. Love love loved it

The food was incredibly good and there was SO much to choose from. The only complaint I have is that it's too far away from where I live. If I ever get back to Montreal, this place is definitely on my to-do list.

We took the BLT wrap and the tempeh skewers. Seriously can't eat them. The tempeh tasted so weird. Definitely not my cup of tea. The coconut bacon basically just tasted like sweet coconut with a bit of a reddish color. It was too sweet to be put in a wrap.   There wasn't much ambiance in the restaurant. It just felt like eating in a cafeteria. The staff isn't that friendly.   Overall, we didn't enjoy it and wouldn't go back.
Another place to fall in love with! The menu is varied and original,  place has a nice ambiance and staff is friendly!  Loved it !
I am a big fan of this small place in Montreal for their healthy and delicious vegan meal!

Des crêpes, des crêpes! Oh oui j'en veux, surtout en brunch le dimanche!  Mais les crêpes vegan aux bleuets de Aux Vivres j'en voudrais tous les jours : leur moelleux n'avait rien à envier à des crêpes classiques. Oui oui, je vous l'assure. L'essayer c'est l'adopter. De plus cette portion généreuse est accompagnée de sirop à l'érable et d'une crème de noix, et des fruits : un délice!  Toute la carte semble appétissante, il y a des bols de crudités, des sandwichs, des burgers. Bref beaucoup de choix que je suis impatiente de pouvoir essayer lors de ma prochaine venue.  L'ambiance était plutôt familiale ce dimanche midi mais très agréable, un peu de musique. C'est très spacieux et le service roule bien donc peu d'attente malgré le monde, ce qui est parfait.
a treat to dine at Aux Vivres. critiques: service is slow (but they are often very busy), their portions are huge and prices are on the expensive side. other than that, yum yum!

Huge portions, the server was very nice, food itself fresh but essentially a giant thai bowl of carrots and three wedges of tofu with undercooked rice. The desserts looked amazing. I feel like this sort of place has built such a rep that they focus on image expansion and commercialization as opposed to actual food, there are cheaper vegan restaurants with better food in the city.

Great vegan brunch  it was simply delicious!   I personally loved the Huevos rancheros, but my boyfriend's polenta was also very good. You can see everything is freshly made.  Good service. We will definitely go back.

Whilst in town for a music festival, we needed a quick healthy kick in the gut. Aux Vivres served up a satisfying brunch full of health. We started with a Juice and coffee. The Juice was so hearty I could've had it as a meal on its own. The coffee was good and strong but note they're not keen on giving free refills on your cup.   Most places had a wait for brunch but there is an enormous amount of seating here so we got in quickly and scored a corner booth.  I had a quinoa scramble meal. It was incredibly fresh and made me feel clean without feeling like I had to eat cardboard. Win!

This is a review of Aux Vivres' takeout annex. The restaurant has always been great--dependably delicious food, generous portions, efficient service. The takeout spot, however, is overpriced. My partner ordered and paid $7 for a piece of pie that was laughably tiny when arrived. (Think of a playing card cut diagonally and you'll get the picture.) He said it tasted okay, but he would never go back there again. It's insulting.

Plesantly surprised! We tried a variety of things. I have the Latke Burger. It was okay, not the best, everything was falling out and slightly bland. My boyfriend had the Dragon sandwhich/wrap which was amazing and HUGE! We were worried it would be small and not filling but wow... He eats alot and half was already enough. All the sauces were amazing and tasty you wouldn't even know they're vegan. I loved the tempeh, especially since I hate tofu.

Still one of the best vegan joints in town; special brunch options on weekends, though they recently changed the brunch menu and added heuvos rancheros and replaced their awesome waffles with moderately okay pancakes.  If you're going for weekend brunch make sure to go early, massive lineups after 12:30 (parking is free before 1pm also)

Everything was absolutely delicious!  My grumpy carnivore husband did not want to go with me.  He met me in front of the door of the place saying he had to brave himself to enter a world of veganism.   When we left, he admitted to having had an excellent meal!   Their cornbread was delicious, so was their tempeh appetizer.    Most of their dishes are naturally vegan, that is, they are not typical meat dishes where tofu replaces the meat.  They come from a variety of cuisines but mainly Indian and Mediterranean.     Everything is fresh and tasty.   I highly recommend this place!

I feel this place deserves an update not because my opinion has changed, but because I was recently in Montreal for three days and ate here twice. That's the second time that happened. And that says something.  The staff is just amazing. They're patient, kind, give great suggestions, and, on the whole, really rule. My server told my indecisive self to go with the tempeh burger, served with excellent cole slaw, chipotle ketchup, and potato wedges ($9), and I'm happy I did. Fantastic. And it's absolutely massive, so prepare to enjoy the glory of a light-night snack!  It's a great place to take yourself on a solo date too. No wait if you sit at the counter (where, if you feel like it, you'll get to shoot the shit with wonderful strangers. Trust me.).

Spent a year traveling weekly to montreal for work - aux vivres was my go to spot. I'd eat here at least 2 meals a week - i got to try most of their menu! Love everything ! Tons of flavour and variety - from heavy to light meals, lunch and dinner, there is something to suit your mood. Yummy desserts and great loose leaf tea selection too. Reminds me of 'Fresh' in Toronto - similar vibe, menu and style.

Vegan comfort food with great deserts and a liquor license. Prompt service regardless of how busy it is.  Delicious smoothies- particularly the chocolate one and the blue monkey.  Big portions- awesome for lunches. (French-Canadian translation)

Je sais que la plupart des gens aiment beaucoup Aux Vivres, mais chaque fois que j'y vais, je me dis " Meh! ". Ce n'est pas que ce n'est pas bon... C'est simplement ordinaire à mon avis.  Ils proposent une grande variété de plats végétariens, végétaliens et sans gluten que ce soit pour le brunch, le lunch ou le souper. Le personnel est poli et sympathique, et n'hésite pas à faire des recommandations. Les portions sont hyper généreuses et les plats très abordables.

Awesome vegan restaurant giving me a feeling where i can get re-energize not only with the bright decor but also with the colourful food they served.  The Mekong sandwich with the peanut sauce is so yummy and the portion are big.  And the desserts are not too sweet. I love it. Definitely will come back.

Un très bon restaurant vegan....qui saura également convenir aux non-vegans!  La carte est diversifiée et alléchante....et vraiment très intéressante pour les "non pratiquants" du veganisme! Tous les plats goûtes autour de notre table étaient goûteux et originaux....une vraie découverte!

This is my favorite restaurant in Montreal! Yes, I love poutine and crepes, but if you want some amazing veggie comfort food come here! Every time I'm in town this is a go to spot. The staff is very welcoming and always gives us a booth in the back(which is less crowded and more intimate than the front of the house). The chili is very good, the vegan soups hit the spot( if you make trips up to Montreal in the cold months esp., as my husband and I always seem to.)  The veggie burger is homemade (unlike the frozen stuff you get elsewhere).  I have not tried their brunch yet, but I will next time I'm in town. Also Blvd. Saint Laurent and Saint Denis are filled with nice shops, eateries, coffee houses, so you could spend a whole just food hopping and absorbing the culture.   If you're driving, you can find parking on the side streets off of Blvd. Saint-Laurent.

This restaurant has great food. I have been here numerous times, and my favourite entree is the "blt", made with smoked coconut chunks. The potato wedges are a nice side dish, and come with some interesting dipping sauces. The atmosphere is very casual and the staff are friendly and helpful. The neighbourhood has a fun vibe, so you can go for a walk and explore the neighbourhood after dinner if you are new to Montreal or travelling.

Great vegan. Dragonbowl or thaibowl + vege pâté wrap for 2 are filling and tasty. Ginger cookie is a must.  Ambience is slightly lacking, but the good food and prices make up for it!  Aux Vivres is our go-to vege takeout spot.

One of the best places to eat in Montreal. Maybe Anthony Bourdain considers skipping Joe Beef next time he's in town and trying this place instead to test his anti-vegan views --- dude, the food here is really good!   Some of best brunch and lunch food in Montreal. Just happens to be vegan.   If you still just want steak, at least come for the dessert. There is no reasonable emotional objection to at least trying a vegan dessert.

i appreciate the prompt service in aux vivres in montreal. i ordered the tempeh burger with a side of fries and purple cabbage which i extremely enjoyed. the lettuce in the burger was fresh and plentiful. the texture of the patty resembled meat to me. the moisture of the burger was delicious and again reminded me of meat. even though i am vegan, i found it still delicious to taste meat. i also enjoyed the ketchup sauce which was created by tomatoe sauce it seems like which i think is a good idea to make ketchup sauce
Been here twice now and even though I'm not vegan, it doesn't matter, I love this place!  The service is amazing, everybody is beyond friendly and the food comes fresh and quick!

I remember Aux Vivres when it was a small restaurant on Saint Dominique back in 2000. Sadly the quality has declined substantially since then. The dragon bowl and the vege lox sandwich were my former go to orders and the chapati with nut butter was one of my favorite snacks.    Yesterday we ordered take out and everything was disappointing. Tofu was not replaced with tempeh as requested, the brownies were prepackaged and fell flat with everyone, the rice bowls were missing rice, and the sandwiches were weak on fillings and heavy on carbs - I had to remove a large amount of chapati to taste the vegelox I was craving. The dragon sauce remains delicious but can easily be recreated at home or bought on site. The chapati is more authentic these days but it does not pair well with the nut butter.  I had a pretty big craving for aux vivres yesterday and am beyond disappointed. Can no longer recommend this place.

This was sooo yummy! I had the blueberry pancakes and my boyfriend had the huevos rancheros. The service was lovely and our waitress was super sweet and nice. The place was clean and so were the restrooms. This was our first time in Canada and I was so happy to find various vegan food places. I'm vegan and my boyfriend is vegetarian. I definitely want to come back here and try more of their food, I highly recommend it!
Great place for vegan eats in the plateau. If your gluten intolerant, they got you covered as well. I recommend the vegan BLT, where the "bacon" is toasted coconut. Very tasty.
Great all vegan menu. Attentive staff and bright environment.  Very tasty.
Fantastic brunch!! WOW! Haven't had much of their lunch/dinner options but the Dragon Sauce is the best.
Everything was delicious and original. I had vodkabiscus to drink, végépâté as a starter and blt cesar as main. Huge portions, and everything truly tasty.

The first vegan restaurant in Montreal with a store and food to go place next door. I had the Popeye green juice which is delicious and taste like a lemonade. The salads are huge! I couldn't finish it and was delighted to save the leftovers for another meal. They have an interesting desert menu. Not everything is gluten-free but there are indications on the menu. Their tempeh is handmade in Montreal.
I'm a fan of the food you can order at the express counter. Their dragon sauce is an all time favourite. We can't stop eating their sushi, sandwiches, dragon bowls. Healthy and nutritive.

The food at Aux Vivres will not disappoint vegetarians or meat eaters alike.  The place can get really crowded, but the line moves quickly. Reservations aren't a bad idea.   The offer a very diverse menu and portions are huge.  I love their salads and bowls The last time we went I had the chili which was excellent.  Service can be a little hectic, but pleasant and friendly.

Aux Vivres is by far my favourite vegan restaurant in Montreal.  I really want to try out more dishes, but the gyro pita and mexicali plate are so good that I never want to order anything else. Even my carnivore brother & boyfriend love the chilli.   I also love that they have a take-out store. Vegan tzaziki? YES PLEASE. Chocolate chip cookies? YES PLEASE. It's all soooooooooooo good.   Aux Vivres makes being vegan a breeze.

Great service and tasty food! The server was friendly and informative. Maybe one of the best servers I've ever had. The food came lightning fast (it wasn't a particularly busy time of day, but still) and was delicious. I had the burger with fries. My friend had the wrap special of the day. Overall a great experience.

I stopped into Aux Vivres to-go cafe today for a late-afternoon lunch and it was great. I had the BLT and a chai latte. The BLT was HUGE - it could easily be split between two people for lunch- and the latte was perfectly spiced. This is a perfect drop-in spot for a quick bite. The staff were friendly, and the food was really tasty!

Omg I want to try everything on this menu! I hope I get to go back before the end of my trip!  The wrap portions look humongous!  So many starters to choose from... I started with the Tom Yum soup, and the Tempeh Satay served with spicy peanut sauce. Wow yum yum yum!!!  Then I had the Chili with roasted potatoes as my main, soooo good! Of course I had plenty of leftovers to take home.  My friends had the Dragon Bowl and the Mexicali Plate and they were all equally satisfied. I was actually a little bit surprised about their UNcheesecake, I usually love vegan cheesecake but this one definitely wasn't one of my top faves.  This place is nothing fancy, just quality clean ingredients and good vegan comfort food. And reasonably priced, so it's perfect for an everyday lunch or simple dinner! Very happy :) .

Was my first time at a vegan restaurant and I was pleasantly suprised. Food was really good. Had some tofu scrambled eggs as part of my breakfast and taste was great. Only downside is that you don't have free refills of the coffee, which some people  I went with were disappointed but since I don't drink coffee I did not mind.

There was a line to get in for dinner. We waited about 20 minutes. We got the BLT, which was just okay. We also had the Cosmos plate (souvlaki-style seitan, tzatziki, salad, potato wedges & brown rice). It was very tasty. Even the brown rice had flavor in it; could be from the souvlaki. We decided to try the signature dessert - the (un)cheesecake. It was so delicious, although a bit on the tarter side than expected, that we wanted more desert. We ordered the chocolate apple cake, that was really delicious as well. Would go back when in the area to try perhaps their bowls, which a few people had ordered and I am curious about it.

Aux Vivres is one of the few vegan/vegetarian restaurants in Montreal and is located on St. Laurent. It's a great option if you're looking for healthy, fresh and tasty cuisine. The restaurant itself reminds me of a dinner (so it's very casual), and the staff were very friendly. I think they have a terrace somewhere but.... I didn't see it so maybe that's just a rumor ;-)  I started with the Tonic (ginger, lemon, apple) - my immediate reaction was to purse my lips and widen my eyeballs because DAMN it was tart! But it was refreshingly delicious once I got over my sensory shock!  As a meal, I opted for Le Complet (tofu scramble, Tempeh bacon, cornbread, fresh fruit, salad and sweet potatoes). The tofu scramble was good - I liked the texture and flavor. The cornbread was delicious, as were the sweet potatoes. The salad came with this amazing Dill vinaigrette that was so good, I bought a bottle before leaving. The Tempeh bacon did nothing for me. I can't say I enjoyed the taste or texture at all.  Overall, the portion size was quite good (for me, anyway) and the price was appropriate ($11 for the plate).  I plan to go back and try one of their infamous bowls - I've heard they're amazing!  They have a small shop out front where you can be pre-made meals, or other items like their vinaigrette, baked goods etc.

Meh, try once kinda place.   I love vegetarian food and all but just wasn't feeling this place you know? We came right when they were open so maybe the kitchen wasn't ready yet so my sandwich took awhile to come out. I saw the BLT sandwich on Yelp and it looks so good.   They saw us struggling reading French so they finally gave us an English menu. They should just always leave out English menu!   |BLT sandwich| 11.25 CAD  About $8 US money for a sandwich is not bad considering it's vegetarian. So they replaced the bacon with coconut pieces that had a lot of flavor on its own but too dry for a sandwich. We bought a small box of it on the side for our road trip and it tastes better as a snack. What its lacking was the sauce. It was too dry with all 3 ingredients: coconut pieces, lettuce, tomatoes. I'm glad I shared and only had half of it. Could barely make it through.
Delicious, healthy fare after a day of airport food. The smoothies were a little icy to start, but the Thai and Dragon bowls and the Caesar salad were all sumptuous.

J'ADORE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Everything on the menu is VEGAN friendly. That means I ate safely here without worrying about eggs or milk ingredients.
