During a recent last-minute escapade to Montreal and after a night of fine red wines, sangrias and la terrasse, my friends and I woke up and came here for brunch.  My girls are awesome, totally not vegan, but was totally agreeable in coming here because I wanted to check this place out so badly before departing the city the same day. The place was packed around noon on a rainy Sunday morning and we waited about 15 minutes for a table. The waitress was rude, maybe she didn't like anglophones.. BUT we spoke FRENCH to her, so it's totally NOT us.  I ordered a brunch option called Le Complet, which came with a side salade with green dressing, stir-fry tofu, fake bacon, and corn bread. While my ladies found the stir-fry tofu amazing, I found it a tad bland, the corn bread was good, fake bacon was meh, BUT the side salad was amazing, it was fresh and crisp and the green dressing was divine. This meal also came with coffee or chai, so I chose the chai because it was vegan friendly and I could have my coffee black anytime!  We finished our meal with Gateau Faux-mage... fake cheesecake. It tasted exactly like a real cheesecake.. only less sweet and totally better for you because it's vegan and soy... and probably made with cane-sugar, not the refine white sugar crap.  I would MOST DEF come back here. If only I lived in Montreal. This city has blown me away, I did not know it was veggie-friendly!! :) *LOVE*  Montreal, je t'aime! *bisoux* A la prochaine!

Nous y sommes allés un midi pour luncher entre collègues. Nous avons tous aimé nos plats mais certains ont trouvé que ce n'était pas assez copieux. Effectivement, j'ai l'impression qu'il y a moins de patates dans les assiettes avec burgers, qu'il y a 4 ans... De mon côté, j'ai pris la soupe thai cette fois, et elle est vraiment délicieuse, accompagnée de 4 petits pain... Moi ça m'a suffit comme plat.. Je recommande Aux vivres à tout le monde, c'est une institution vegan à Montréal! :)

Un classique! Toujours aussi frais et savoureux ce bol Dragon. Le personnel est toujours sympathique et le service est rapide. Le stationnement sur StLaurent est toujours accessible. Très peu à dire parce qu'à chaque fois c'est fameux.

I was super excited to go to a vegan/vegetarian place because I've been trying to lead a meat-free diet. However, I was rather disappointed with the food.   My friend had the Soup of the Day (pea soup). She liked it, but I thought it tasted a little under-seasoned, and the texture of the vegetables in the soup was grainy (over cooked?).  I ordered the BLT in a chapati wrap, at a friend's recommendation. The coconut chips were great taste and texture wise (although my friend thought the chips were too hard). My biggest problem was the ranch dressing -- over-powering and way too salty.   I had half of my friend's vegetarian chili, which was great! Good, hearty flavour. Could hardly believe that it didn't contain meat.   Friend's mango lassi was thick, but had too much ice. Not enough of that mango and yogurt tang flavor.   Service was AMAZING. Though the restaurant was busy, we got seated and served very very quickly. Really nice waiters!

I just had best potato wedges I have ever tasted. Their brunch menu is delicious, but I honestly don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. The mango lassi was delicious and very filling. Also the chocolate shake was probably the best I've ever tasted.

Oh man...I am so disappointed to have to give Aux Vivres only 3 stars. I want to give it at least four, but here's the scoop:  The food is tremendous, really excellent. The portions on everything are huge. I ordered the famous coconut BLT (they use liquid smoke and nutritional yeast, then dehydrate the coconut meat) and, stupidly, got a side of roasted potatoes. Wrong! The sandwich on chapati (delicious bread BTW) was the length of my forearm. Potatoes were so much overkill, but still wonderful too. Rounded it off with a Santa Cruz pink lemonade. Yum. Wife got some sort of hummus wrap on chapati and dahl soup.  The service was okay, pretty indifferent, but Montreal waitstaff works at its own pace and stupid Americans who may be used to faster service should just come and chill for a spell. don't worry about the service.  So here's the issue: it was hot as balls inside the restaurant (no AC?), we opted to sit outside. As we finished the meal, we noticed that the bricked in patio (cute with all the veggies growing in raised boxes) must be next to the alley. There was a strong smell of the dumpster and garbage floating across the restaurant and it was so nauseating that I almost threw up! No joke. It was terrible. I literally had to leave the restaurant and go out onto the boulevard  to get some fresh air. It took quite a while to feel better.  People can't smell rot while they eat. It tricks the body into thinking you're eating poison. That is what the gag reflex is for. I cannot really fault Aux Vivres for this, but then again maybe I can. Poor planning on the part of the owners, or maybe they just didn't know.  I will be back to Aux Vivres for sure, because the food is fantastic, but I will be getting it TAKE OUT!!!!

My girlfriend found Aux Vivres as a place she wanted to check out on our long weekend trip to Montreal.  We arrived for brunch on a Sunday morning.  The location was a short walk from the nearest subway station.  We only had to wait a few minutes while two groups in front of us were seated.  The staff and atmosphere of the restaurant was welcoming.  We had both looked at the online menu and picked out a few items we wanted to try.  In the end we both went for the Huevos Rancheros; mine with sweet potatoes and coffee and hers subbed with regular potatoes and chai tea.  She also ordered the granola bowl.    We travel fairly often and usually hit up a couple vegan places; and the Huevos Rancheros at Aux Vivres is one of the best vegan brunches I've had to date.  The tofu scramble, beans, guacamole, pico de gallo and the sweet potatoes with the sauce on top were all perfect to taste.     All the flavors worked together for an awesome plate.  The coffee was okay a well, but nothing special.  I wasn't able to try the Granola Bowl due to an allergy, but the girlfriend enjoyed it and the fruit choice on top of varied and freh.  Overall our visit was an excellent experience.  If I am ever back in the city I'll make it a point to visit again and try other items on the menu.

What a great restaurant! The asian inspired bowls are better than anything you can find in china town. Fresh veggies with amazing homemade sauces and great presentation make this a visual delight as well as mouthwatering, delicious, and healthy.  The food is filling and satisfying.  My daughter always orders the greek platter. Best tzatziki ever. Then there are the vegan desserts. Fantastic! This restaurant is all around amazing. Decor is cute, staff is attentive, and location is prime. If you're in Montreal Au Vivre is a must!

Great vegan joint! The place is clean, service is fast and friendly. In terms of a vegan restaurant they might lack diversity or "originality" in cuisine but the food is great, portions are healthy and the price is worth it!

One of my favourite vegan restaurants.  Nearly every dining experience I have had here has been great.  The price of a meal might make a bit of a dent in your wallet, but it's more than worth it.  In any case, for $12 I usually end up feeling full or nearly full.  The frustrating thing about Aux Vivres is that there are so many things to choose from, and so it is a constant inner struggle every time I visit on whether I should order something I've had before or try something new.  The last time I went I opted for the day's special - some pizza with a side salad.  It was fantastic.  I ordered a gyro to go as well and it was just as good.  During the summer months the creamsicle smoothie is one of the best fluids you could ever put down your throat.  In the colder months (or actually, any time now that I think of it), one of their delicious lattes hits the spot as well.  The staff are knowledgeable, generally friendly, and bilingual.  I have had some servers here in the past give me some attitude after they received my tip (which is always more than 15%), which I did not appreciate - but guess what?  They no longer work there.  The servers usually fill up the water regularly, which is very much appreciated.  It's as if they know I'm dehydrated every time I walk in there.  The atmosphere is semi-comfortable, but not always that inviting.  Sometimes I'm seated right next to other couples and they comment on the insane things I'm saying to my date/friend/self, which can be a little annoying when it's uninvited.  However, the setting is a great place to play the "Guess Who's Not Vegan in the Vegan Restaurant" game, if you're into that sort of thing.  I am glad I don't live next door to Aux Vivres because I would eat there every day.  I would bring my jars of pennies to the bank just to get extra cash to eat another tofu burger.  The staff would know me by name and frown as I would dump change on the counter, begging them to give me just one more slice of uncheesecake.  Yeah, so it's good.  Go try it out if you haven't.  You'll like it.

I went to this place on two occasions. Once with my vegetarian friend (who showed me the place) and once with my girlfriend. Both times were different experience and both were amazing. On my first visit with my friend, there was a pretty big line (I might be exaggerating, the line was maybe 10 minutes), so we decided to use the pick-up counter and eat in a nearby park. We both had sandwiches in chapattis and both we super good (I can say without a doubt that mine was, my friend said his was too). I was looking for something refreshing and fresh, and that was exactly what I got. On my second visit, we got a seat inside. The waiters were very kind and the service was fast. My girlfriend and I both ordered the dragon bowl (a nice bowl of veggies with rice) and a shake (I got bombay banana). The dragon bowl was so delicious and the shake was super flavorful. We had been walking around in the heat all day (and had some sugary stuff earlier) and we just wanted something fresh and healthy. The dragon bowls delivered! Plus it came to 40$ (before tip) for the both of us! I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants something fresh and delicious.

Wrap dragon, sauce dragon, chili, crêpes, smoothies. Pour vrai, j'adore ce resto. La déco laisse un peu à désirer dans la première (ancienne partie) mais à part ça rien à dire sur l'ensemble incluant le service impeccable.

I had heard so many great things about Aux Vivres (and I absolutely LOVE their tzatziki), so I was disappointed to walk in and find it to be more of a "diner" than an actual "restaurant".  It's definitely more of a casual place for a quick bite than somewhere I would go on a date night.  Sadly, there are not many other vegan options in Montreal yet, so despite our trepidation, we stayed to try the food.  Our waitress was very friendly and efficient.  She knew the menu well and was able to suggest a great organic beer for me and a smoothie for my husband that he practically finished in one gulp it was so good.  She also suggested a delicious curry soup that both my husband I and I loved - the Chana  Paratha appetizer did not go over as well.  After that, we opted for burgers, my husband choosing the seitan burger and I took the Aux Vivres burger.  Both were under-cooked and mushy and the roasted potato wedges they were served with seemed like they were yesterday's leftovers; coldish and soggy.  I bet they would have been delicious if they were served fresh & hot from the oven.  Tables were TINY and very cramped - we could barely fit our food and drinks on our little table for two, so I had to keep using the empty table beside me.  I would have liked to try some of the delicious-looking desserts, but we were feeling claustrophobic in our tiny cramped booth, so we   skipped dessert.  Probably won't be back :-(

As a guy who is vegan I appreciate the number of options to have here.  It is a massive menu unlike most places where there a binary option of 1 or 0 .  That being said I did not much care for the main dishes of food and I wanted so much to fall in love with it :( The dragon bowl I did not like the sauce, and it wasn't too good dry.  The chili was pretty good, although that's not something unique to vegan restaurant.  The blt was okay but I didn't really like the taste too much.  I tried another appetizer of dipping bread into a nice sauce , that was good.   The carrot cake was excellent and I would like to try more deserts.   The service was great, very friendly both times, nice vibe in the restaurant .   It didn't seem healthy food to me, the dragon bowl certainly was, although the rest seemed to be a one way trip to gut city.  Maybe I just need to order different dishes to get a better experience , but I'm not gonna try again until next time in montreal.

Tester lors de la fête d'une amie, nous avons pris à emporter.  Malgré la file d'attente et la salle du restaurant plein à craquer, nous avons été servis rapidement.  J'ai goûté deux de leurs jus .... juste hallucinant (sinon j'en aurais pas pris deux ^^ ), le popeye et le tonique (mon préféré).  Pour le repas j'ai pris le burger Aux Vivres, vraiment bon, pour un burgers VG, il était vraiment bien garnis et ça goûte tellement plus que burger normal.  J'ai aussi pu goûter le BLT ( Bacon Laitue Tomate) d'un ami, oui oui bacon, mais du bacon VG, fait à base de chair de noix de coco, et bien sincèrement c'est excellent, malgré mon scepticisme au début. On retrouve la même texture et le coté fumé aussi, sauf qu'il y a un goût de coco.

Interesting diner type feel , ugly decor and very dim,, also in front of the front door they have nasty plastic curtain ,,, first thing we got was the water received in a large mason jar,, tasted like water from a Chinese food restaurant, not cold at all,, I got the Thai tofu side with a lug head beer,, beer was interesting, tasted very carbonated,, and had a really bitter taste of hopps,, got my food,, rim of the dish was dirty,, Tofu tasted like it was frozen ,, taste very bland (cardboardish) and it was very tough,, peanut sauce that came with it was quite good actually along with the roasted peanuts ,, it seems the only thing this place knows how to cook is the veggies ,, the Bok choy was really good along with the pickled cabbage and carrots ,, lettuce tasted old and I got something that resembled turnips which tasted like nothing,, I didn't dare taste the rice ,, my friend got the dish and her brown rice looked overcooked I tasted it and it was utterly disgusting ,, it was mushy and so bland,, basil on top of my dish was also old ,, this was my first time to a vegan place and vegan restaurants pride themselves on fresh food , this was a disgrace.

Well for a non vegan...let me tell up you that this place is excellent! I was brought in there by a friend to try it out and what a surprise!! I loved every piece of my meal: I got the brown rice bowl Dragon and I have to say it was delicious. We also got te chocolate banane pie at the end which we swallowed in 2 bites ;) overall excellent service and food, don't hesitate to go!

Pretty decent vegan place that I frequent when I am in the plateau/mile end area. The portions sizes are decent and the prices are pretty cheap. When the food is good, it's really good, when it's bad, it's downright awful.   Good : The Sirocco wrap, if you get in the take out section is only $5.49. The Dragon sauce is probably the best to compliment that wrap. The 'cheese' scone and 'un-cheese' cakes are probably my personal favorites and I would go out of my way to get those. The Mezze Mediterranean w/ Chapati will not disappoint either!    Bad : Avoid brunch if possible, the blueberry crepes are really dry. The chili fries were a bit cold...and dry. Not impressed with their portobello burger either. There's not much flavour in the tofu, I think it's grilled without seasoning.   Bottom Line : I have my favorites, but this is not the place to be adventurous because most stuff are pretty bland without the sauces or just really dry. However, it's still my go to place for cheap vegan foods.

Ate here on a Monday, very busy restaurant. There were four of us, each tried a different dish and all were pleased. Waitress was attentive but reserved. Lacked spark or personality. Otherwise, a good meal for all.

Alright let me start off by saying that Montreal's vegetarian scene is mad strong. And I'm only realizing this now that I'm away from all of my faves :(  Anyway,  Aux Vivres always gives me these "I can't believe this meal has no meat" moments. The food is top-notch, super flavorful, and gets me to eat food I normally wouldn't (who knew tempeh is sooooo good??)  My go-to meal used to be the polenta brunch, but then I stumbled upon the famous dragon bowl and never looked back. Honestly, if you don't know what to get, just go for this guy. It's full of flavor (the sauce is key) and also filling!   I've gotten takeout from Aux Vivres, been to the restaurant, gone there for brunch, gone there for supper, had one of their premade bowls... I feel like I've experienced every aspect, and it's always been a good experience!

The food is tasty and unusually large-portioned for a "Save the Earth" place.  Despite everything I'm a fan.  This is probably because they are really friendly as people though others may disagree.  The "everything" I refer to is...  EXPENSIVE, slow service, sometimes long lines, hippie tree huggers everywhere, dirty  washrooms, no daily specials, crappy desserts (because they are vegan!), uncomfortable seating, renovations that took months instead of weeks, and completely untrained service.

Get the dragon bowl! I got a burger when I came here (which is not bad), but when I took a little sample of my friend's dragon bowl...oh the regret! Definitely coming back here to devour the whole thing myself.   The decor here is simple and clean. The waitress who served us was very helpful in giving us recommendations and we had a nice little chat about that secret sauce in that dragon bowl too. I heard their smoothies are pretty awesome, so there's another thing to add to my "to try" list.

I stopped by this wonderful small vegan spot to try out one of their awesome smoothies. Aux Vivres has two sections...the resto where you can have a sit down meal and the takeout section. The smoothies come in 6 flavors and are truly delicious! I tried the mango smoothie which was pefect for a warm summer day. The ingredients are fresh and the smoothies themselves are refreshing and so tasty! Will defintaely be back!

A must for vegans visiting Montreal. We went on a Saturday night, and we got in just before the big dinner rush. There was a wait for tables the entire time we were there. Lots of variety on the menu, and very reasonably priced. I'll be going back on my next trip to Montreal.

Let me start by saying that I'm a meat lover, which is the reason I can't give this restaurant 5 stars. Having said that, this place is sublime...they're food is absolutely delicious!  A friend and I arrived a bit before 1pm on good Friday and the place was full, but they gave us a table within a few minutes. As the meat lover I am, I had a hard time navigating the menu so I asked the waitress for help and she helped me very diligently. My friend got the Dragon Bowl with tempeh and I got the Buddha Bowl with tempeh...I didn't even know what tempeh was! Food arrived and we devoured it, and I can stress how surprised vegan food can be so good! For dessert we even shared an "uncheesecake" (in French the pun was better, at "gateau au faux-mage") and however they make it, it tasted exactly like cheesecake. In the end, my friend and I each spent about $20.  If you're a carnivore and you're looking for a small break from meat, or your date likes vegetarian/vegetalian food, this place will be appropriate!

Being condemn to live in suburbia, I have not been to an establishment with such cool vibe. I had the Mexicali Plate. Well presented with colours and textures, it's a pretty incentive to eat healthy. Dare I say it, meat may be overrated.

Coconut! Bacon!  Is there anything else left to say?  Ok, maybe a little. Housemade flatbread, fresh vegetables, huge portions, a cheesecake that I honestly didn't love...but...coconut bacon! I love vegan BLTs with tempeh, but coconut bacon is just so much more exciting.

Okay, so, my first meal in Montreal, this is a famous vegetarian/vegan place in town.  The wait was not very long, about 20 minutes, but hey, must be good!  The food was actually good but not amazing.  The sandwiches are a bit blend, needs seasoning, even for vegan you need seasoning.  They did gave us some dipping sauce for the sandwiches, but how does that work with sandwiches which aren't even in a torpedo shape?  I got an shake to go with my meal.  I was starving and had to get some sort of protein.  Overall, the experience was a bit rushed and crowded but the food justified the wait.    Here's my horrible experience with the hostess.  She should not be a hostess at this restaurant.  I'm a Canadian myself, but lives and works in the US.  At the counter, I handed my american $20 bills to the hostess to pay for the meal.  Her first reaction was "This bill is fake!"  I said what?  What do you mean by fake?  She claim the graphic design on the american $20 bill is fake.  I assume she was joking with me so I laughingly told her the bill is an older version of the new bill.  Its still valid, just was printed in the 1970s not the year 2000.  She then yelled at me called me a liar and ran off into the kitchen (the restaurant is crowded and loud).  Leaving me, my friends, and the poor waitress staring at each other blindly.  The waitress said "sorry." and smiles and sneaks away.  I then pulled out my other $20 USD with the UPDATED graphics.  The hostess came back and I handed her the $20 USD bills.  She stared at them and examines them with her high tech possibly racist eyes.  She stared at me and angrily shelved me the change.   By this point I'm ragingly angry.  I was determined to get her fired, but my boyfriend talked me out of acting as silly as the hostess.  I walked to the waitress and gave her a $10 CND for tip, since she was so nice to us.  Then we left.    About 6 blocks later, I realized the hostess gave me back the wrong change, she had given me $10 CND short of change.  At that moment I had to decide whether I should make the rest of my trip about getting her fired or enjoying Montreal with my fellow french canadian friends.  I chose the third option, yelp.

I'm not a vegetarian but I enjoyed my meal here. I had waffles for brunch. Wasn't crazy about the soy "bacon" but the rest was really good.  Haven't been back in a while but would recommend even if you aren't vegan.

Bland, Overpriced. Plus bad service.   We stumbled upon this cool-looking place, hungry and tired after a bike ride. Nice décor and signage, great playlist, but surprisingly lacklustre food.  One of us had the assiette mumbai - under-spiced, overcooked, and disappointing at 14 bucks. I ordered  the soup de jour, which arrived only after I asked about 5 times.  It too was devoid of any flavour, really. If you want really good, tasty vegetarian food in Montreal,  just go to any of the numerous falafel joints you run into.  This place is seriously, inexplicably overrated.

THEIR BLT IS THE BEST THING I'VE EVER EATEN. My friend who lived in Montreal for a while told me that its his favourite BLT (and he's not even vegan.) So i had to check this place out. SO worth it. Amazingly large blt wrap filled with fantastic coconut bacon and a really amazing flavourful sauce. So fresh and huge!  I want to visit Montreal just to go back there

First visit to a little vegan place and we loved it. The staff is bilingual and incredibly helpful and polite.  However what most reviews fail to mention is that Aux  Vivres is also a small vegan food shop as well! It was pleasantly surprising, mostly because we could freely shop around while waiting for our fresh food. The smoothie was fantastic- raw and pure fruit juice, and the portion size for the burger and fries we had were perfect! The burger was absolutely delicious, moist, and the right amount of spicy. We would definitely go again :)

The sandwich are okay, the portions are really big though. The tempeh was really good, especially the sauce coming with it. Planning on going back to taste other stuffs on their menu  I was really impressed by the gateau fauxmage A MUST seriously.   The staffs are really friendly

Alright. I found it. The best vegetarian restaurant in Montreal (and believe me, I've spent a lot of time and money searching).  We had the sampler plate of spreads, served with warm chapati. We were blown away by the beauty and creativity of it. Tofu cream? How cute! Olive tapenade - mindblowingly delicious. We promised ourselves we'd eat lightly - but everything disappeared! Who stole the chapati? We couldn't have eaten all that?! Ok, ok, fine. We just had to.  My dragon bowl is what I wish every meal could be. Warm, filling, delicious, and exciting. Hello, delicious, incredibly unique and inimitable sauce! Where did you come from? Can I marry you? Why is my friend kissing her BLT? Does she want to marry it too?  There's also great music playing and a great, brightly-lit atmosphere. Waiters are all warm and attentive. The desserts make symphonies resound in your head for hours.  Next time I'm bringing my sleeping bag and never leaving.

Great food here! There were so many good looking options, which did make making a decision hard. We got the Bombay smoothie which had masala in it, yum! We also got the spread platter served with chapati, probably my favorite. We ended the meal with the Thai peanut bowl, which was also very fresh, yet hearty. Servings are large so you get quite full even though ingredients are plant based.  We went on a Monday during the lunch hour and they were so busy the servers were literally almost running around. The service was slower than what you would expect, but it was fine given we're on vacation.

The food here is substantial and delicious. This tied with au pied de cochon for favorite restaurant in Montreal.  Mekong was delicious, satay sauce and normal fillings.  The lox spread is out of this world. Amazing. Exactly like real lox. Magic from dulse and carrot pulp.  The multi-spread appetizer is a great intro to the food here.  BLT is also amazing. The coconut is smoked/salted just right to swap for bacon. Maybe too much lettuce and not enough mayo for me, but very good.  Souvlaki is good. Burgers are amazing and meaty.

Found this place on Yelp. My vegetarian boyfriend said it was his favorite meal in Montreal! He got the Aux Vivres burger, and I had the Chana Chapati sandwich -- both were great. I also tried the Bombay Banane smoothie to begin and we shared tempeh satay. Excellent! We had a reservation. Service was excellent - one small irritant was that after we were seated, it took about 20 minutes for a server to come over. Other parties came in and were seated and served before anyone came over. But overall, excellent food at this busy restaurant!

Nous avions pris à livrer. Cela semblait réellement appétissant, et un peu hors de nos habitudes (c'est bon la viande !). Puis tant de monde nous en avait dit tant de bien !  Mais vraiment, quelle déception. Au final, c'est une salade composée sans rien de bien particulier sauf la sauce et le tempeh. Pour la première, une dragon, et il reste un gout bien étrange dans la bouche, qui masque le gout des autres aliments. Pour le second, une découverte : ça ressemble à du poulet, mais c'est pas du poulet. Et c'est juste pas bon.  Bref, on ne fera pas l'effort d'y aller.

Super cute vegan diner with ample amount of choice! I had the Thai bowl, but it was a little underwhelming compared to some of the rice bowls I've had at places in Toronto, like Fresh. The flavours were a little bland and nothing really stood out. However, it did taste okay and it was a good, sizeable portion. My friend got the sirocco chipati and it was massive! It's definitely an item you can share amongst two if you aren't extremely hungry. Overall the service was great, the staff really knew the menu items like the back of their hand. I only wish the food was slightly more flavourful!

We dined at this restaurant and tried about 4 dishes, all of them were fine but its more a lunch place then for dinner.    I wouldnt come here expecting a gourmet dinner, but i would come again for a simple lunch!

Un des meilleurs restaurants végétarien à Montréal.  Vous ne vous tromper pas en allant mangeant à Aux Vivres. Le plus plate à manger là-bas est qu'il faut faire un choix sur un seul plate.  Je recommande le bol dragon pour une bonne assiette.   Si vous êtes plus du genre sandwichs, le BLT goûte vraiment le bacon et vaut le coup d'oeil. Même chose pour le sandwich avec des pois chiches et de l'hummus. Mon meilleur moment est quand j'y vais à deux personnes et qu'on échange nos moitiés de sandwich.  Vraiment un bon choix de restaurant, que vous soyez végétarien, végétalien ou carnivore comme moi.
Really like their home made wrap with choice of curry sauce or eggplant. Though the other stuff I'm sick off pretty quickly. Tastes good everytime but it's not a place I go often.

Vegan vittles have never tasted so good as they do at this bright cheery cafe. I went here on my birthday after reading Yelp reviews and was not disappointed. The waitress told us that the recipe for the sauce on the Dragon Bowl was a secret and it wasn't hard to figure out why--it was amazing! It tasted like the love child of tahini, sesame oil and several other things I'd love to identify. With a pile of veggies and rice, it was a party in my mouth! We also tried a Thai peanut salad with tempeh, which was also delicious, and their "Tonique"--a blend of apple, lemon and ginger juices. This was probably the best meal I've had in a long, long time. Why can't making healthy choices always taste this good? I plan to try and replicate the dragon sauce and Tonique at home, but it's hard to imagine my own efforts would stand up to the amazing Aux Vivres. The rest of their menu looked as enticing as what we had. I'd probably be in danger of going here 2-3 times per week if I lived in Montreal. Happy birthday to me!

I finally visited Aux Vivres after hearing so much about this place. I left feeling somewhat disappointed.  I ordered the latke burger dressed with vegan tzatziki, tomato, pickle and lettuce on a whole wheat burger bun, served with potato wedges. There was a long hair on my plate under the burger so that wasn't a great start. I threw it away as a reflex before I could say anything to the waiter so that's on me. But how did they not catch that? The patty itself was made of sweet potatoes and beets so that was pretty yummy. I also liked their vegan tzatziki but their potatoes were bland and the pieces were way too large.  My sister ordered the BLT that comes with coconut chips instead of bacon. The wrap was so huge she had to take half home and it doesn't even come with a side! She would have preferred if the wrap was half the size but with interesting sides like a soup & salad.   I hated that they sat us near the window as it was way too hot there from the sun. The people who got to sit away from the windows were better off. The banquette side is pretty uncomfortable so I just wanted to leave the whole time. The service was great though. Fast, friendly, polite. The food legit came out within 5 mins!  We shared a large berry smoothie, which was delicious and refreshing. We also tried the banana chocolate pie; it was rich and decadent. Yum. I just wish that instead of a coconut crust, it was a graham cracker one. They should describe it or make it more clear on the menu.  So overall, I feel like the menu relies too heavily on soy substitutes (tofu & tempeh) to replace animal products, unlike at Green Panther, Crudessence, Lola Rosa, etc. I'll probably give their new Westmount location a try when it opens since it's so close to me but I think if I'm craving healthy, I'll just go to Mandy's or Green Panther. Great option for vegans though!

I NEED TO STEAL THIS RESTAURANT & TRANSPLANT IT INTO TORONTO/GTA.   Montreal's first vegan restaurant and definitely one of the BEST I've ever tried. They have a huge menu where EVERYTHING is vegan and I don't have worries on 'hm, would this have egg/dairy in it?' ..needless to say, it's so blessed. We ate here pretty much daily on our montreal trip and we were so so so happy with it.   Service is top notch and they're super friendly AND bilingual. Bless. Food came out very quickly too. The menu is HUUUGE and I wanted to eat everything, to be honest. I was sad that I didn't get to try the blueberry pancakes for brunch. I did try the BLT made with coconut bacon and the portions made my inner fat kid extremely happy.. it was pretty much good enough for two people. I'm used to the vegan restaurants in the greater toronto area charging people $30 for a lettuce leaf so when the food came, you can tell I was a happy child.. I couldn't even finish more than half of the thai bowl. In addition to that, heir food is very high quality & definitely fresh.  The star of the show is definitely their desserts - if you're vegan, you definitely feel me on this one: it's SOOOO difficult to find vegan desserts just anywhere. I definitely took advantage. Did I order vegan cheesecake (gateau faux-mage .. so cute) for brunch dessert? You bet the hell I did! It was definitely just like real cheesecake and unbelievably creamy. Um yes, please. Can someone please make this for me back home?!?!? I crave it, just thinking about it and I don't even like sweets, so wtf?   Definitely one of my top must-visits whenever I come back to mtl.

Everyone is right. The Dragon Bowl is divine. Sitting solo at the bar, I was served quickly by a friendly waitress, and had the perfect perch to watch the smoothies getting buzzed. Do I want a creamsicle? With coconut milk, orange juice, carrot juice and vanilla. Yes I do!  It's a busy bustle, full of healthy looking people sporting yoga mats, talking about tennis and scarfing down the best tasting veggies I've had in a long long time. And yes, we all were taking pictures of our big bowls.   I'm already craving my next meal here, and I'm still munching on the leftover beets, carrots, grilled tempah, organic brown rice, daikon, rice, cabbage as I write!

Ah! Aux Vivres! Un classique des restaurants végétaliens de Montréal! Un de mes préférés, mais vous allez comprendre pourquoi je donne 4 étoiles et non pas 5. À ma première visite j'ai commandé le complet: Exquis tofu brouillé, parfaites patates douces, savoureux bacon de tempeh, une belle salade avec une délicieuse sauce à l'aneth et le meilleur pain de maïs que j'ai mangé de ma vie. Je suis littéralement tombée en amour, et mes autres visites ont confirmé que Aux Vivres était mon restaurant végé "to go".   Je vous dirais que les classiques sont sans hésiter le BLT (wrap (énorme) composé de bacon de coconut, laitue, tomate et beurre végé), le Burger Aux Vivres (Galette jardinière vraiment exquise, oignons caramélisé, mayo chipotle) et le fameux Bol Dragon (Plein de légumes, tofu grillé à la perfection du riz brun bio et une sauce qui vous fera hésiter à chaque fois que l'envie vous prendra d'essayer un autre plat que le Bol Dragon: ELLE EST TELLEMENT BONNE!).   J'ai essayé le Burger portobello, qui n'était pas si fantastique que ça; le champignon était imbibé d'eau et franchement ça goutait pas grand chose. Les patates qui viennent avec les burgers sont aussi pas si fantastique (on perd des points ici, je suis une vraie fanatique de patates!), elle sont un peu trop grosses, ce qui fait qu'on perd le goût des assaissonements qui les entourent et qui ne sont pas assez abondants.   Le bol Bouddha est à tomber par terre: La sauce Wafu est excellente! Les smoothies sont tous bons, j'ai pas peur d'en commander un au hasard je sais que je vais être satisfaite. Le tonique Pomme-citron-gingembre est un coup de coeur! Ça goute beaucoup le gingembre, mais l'acidité du jus de citron et le sucre de la pomme vient bien balancer le tout!  Une de mes amies a déjà pris les frites au chili; même remarqué pour les patates exprimée plus haut, le chili était bon mais il faudrait retravailler les frites! L'assiette Mumbai est très savoureuse aussi.  Pour ce qui est des brunchs, mon préféré reste le complet: La Polenta est bonne, mais je ne suis pas fan de la genre de "bisque" de fève noires. Et pour les gauffres elles sont exquises! Et énormes! Un must! Mais personnellement je suis plus du type salé pour le déjeuner :) Finalement les desserts. Je n'en ai gouté que 3: Le gateau choco-pomme ne goutait pas les pommes, le brownie était un peu sec, mais la tarte choco-banane, WOW! Mais j'abandonne pas, il me tarde d'essayer le Brownie au Chipotle et leur fameux gâteau aux carottes!  Alors Overall: Un must, les prix sont juste et puisqu'ils font la livraison, ça me fait des bons repas équilibrés quand j'ai pas envie de cuisiner! Malgré les quelques points négatif (qui, dans le fond, sont juste une question de goût) je dirais que c'est mon restaurant préféré, je n'en suis jamais ressortie déçue et il remplit beaucoup plus de mes critères d'appréciations que la plupart des autres resto, végé ou non. L'ambiance est toujours agréable, le staff est charmant et la nourriture arrive rapidement. Parfait pour un souper en famille ou entre amis; il ne manque que la bière et j'aurais donné 5 étoiles! Osez, la viande vous manquera pas je peux vous l'assurer!

Solid vegan restaurant. Coming from Toronto it was nothing mind-boggling, but it was respectable. If you've never been to a vegan restaurant before you'll enjoy yourself.  The gyro and the aux vivres burger were both good. A friend ordered the thai bowl and said it was disappointing.  After all the rave reviews for the desserts on yelp I was fairly disapointed. Boyfriend and I shared the chocolate apple pie and the chocolate banana pie and they were both pretty meh.

The menu is extensive and I'm sure any vegan you take here will be happy and impressed with the options. However, the sandwiches are mostly lettuce and cost more than $11 - so that is never my order. I usually go for the dragon bowl or the veggie burger or the "soul food" mumbai plate - all of which I think are delicious.  I've taken out of town visitors here who have been impressed with the menu - and they've enjoyed their meal! There is a nice terrace out the back for the summer months.  I did have one ridiculous experience where I ordered the Chana Paratha, described in the menu as: spiced Indian flatbread topped with chana, sour cream, cilantro [now it seems to have changed to mint] & tamarind chutney. When it arrived with 2 cilantro leaves, I asked for a little more and they said they'd have to charge me .75cents. Sure, whatever. A plate arrived with one sprig of cilantro and another 2 leaves. At the same meal, they also charged us for extra dressing. The whole thing struck me as a little classless and a bit ridiculous; and having been a regular, kinda pissed me off. One star docked.  The food is good and creative but if you've been going here for a few years, then you may remember when the staff were friendlier, the portions more generous and the prices lower... Second star docked.

I went here on my recent weekend trip to Montreal after read recs on yelp. We went pretty out of our way to go here for lunch and we enjoyed it but were not blown away. We shared the cold plate with a delicious veg pate, hummus, veggie puree, and a veg lox which I was less excited about. We also split a seitan sandwich was good and a choc coconut smoothie. Would love to have a place like this near me, but again did not fee like a place worth walking 25 blocks out of our way.
This place gets 5 stars for their huge, fresh selection of vegan options. I've eaten here for the past 2 days and couldn't be happier.
+1 = loved the Buddha bowl +1 = excellent apple pie +1 = friendly service! +1 = healthy! +1 = fair prices  Will definitely be back next time I'm in Montreal

great food and smoothies!! Had the blue monkey smoothie which was insanely good, I actually didn't even want to order it but the person I was with wanted it so I agreed, and it was just really the best. The BLT is crazy good too, coconut "bacon" is insane, I just don't know how they do it! And the chapati is great. The only thing is that the portions are huge so probably splitting one sandwich would be enough for two people, and a smoothie of course.

So when I travel I always look up the best food in the area. This place was on the top of the list for vegan food and I hopped in an uber and came straight here.  The concept of the food is what got me. They're food is an Indian Mediterranean fusion, and you could taste it in the food. The spot is very homey, and the servers were really prompt. Also price wise- very affordable!  I got the coconut bacon BLT because that's what I read was good, but it personally wasn't my favorite dish at the table. It was too little bacon and too much lettuce for my preference.   But wow at the rest of the food- the tempeh in peanut sauce, the La Companion brunch plate, and everything else. Just wow.   Please go here if you want large portions of really great food!! Ive never eaten a tempeh dish made this well!

I do not care if you are vegan, vegetarian, carnivore or omnivore, but you have to try this restaurant out!  I came here on a Saturday night with a friend and here's how it went:  Pros: - Extremely friendly staff, smiles on everyone's faces - No wait or minimal wait to get seated - Fast service (Saturday night from appy to dessert took us only 45 minutes) - Delicious smoothies! I had a Bombay Banana smoothie and miss awesome had a zesty lime-celeri smoothie (forgot name). They were made on spot and were refreshing! - Generous portions: had us rolling after we were done - Food? YUM. We had the large Chili and a Mekong sandwich and we couldn't finish them all. But we saved space for a choco-banana cake!   Cons: - Price-wise is alright but not too shabby! - Mekong's peanut butter sauce was a bit on the sweet side, but not that bad!  Extras: I am actually omnivore but I really enjoyed it! I will definitely return.   Thank you Aux Vivres for being vegan-friendly.

This is just one of those place that vegans and vegetarians alike enjoy going to. And they have done a good job of it.   Everything we ordered I enjoyed. Particularly I liked the Bombay smoothy and the channa with paratha.   One thing I noticed is that there were three either recent-made-moms or about-to-be-moms there. I don't know if it means anything, but it is something I observed while I was there. I guess it is a family friendly place.  This place is worth a visit. You will not be disappointed. There is tons of variety. You might only be disappointed that you can't eat it all at once. :)

This place is amazing. We could hardly believe everything was vegan. We're pretty sure the food is made out of angel livers and unicorn poop.  Particularly mind-blowing: The carrot soup and the brownie with nuts.  Guys, please open a restaurant in San Francisco!

This place is a decent vegan restaurant but today i found a 1" piece of plastic in my salad and it reminded me of the time they had to close for 2 months because one of their employees lost his arm in the bread maker.

The amount of vegan options at this restaurant was amazing! Absolutely everything!! It's a relief to be able to go into a restaurant not have to pick and choose and ask 1 million questions. I was only in Montreal for the weekend and I went to days in a row! Love this place I highly recommend

We loved this place.  We tried 3 different sandwiches.  Sandwich Sirocco, Sandwich Dragon, & Sandwich Chana.   Each one was delicious,  We also had theTempeh Satay which we really liked.  It was Saturday afternoon and bitter cold but the place was quite busy with a lot of young people enjoying a really nice ambiance. Our server was very friendly and efficient.  Parking is in the street but we had no trouble finding a spot.  I can't wait to go back.

I expected to hate it... Now I'll probably go back. I must admit the thought of eating in a vegan restaurant was about as interesting as the thought of sawing my own leg off!   In a restaurant world of fatty food, this place fills my need for some healthy grub.   The warp was huuuuuuuge. The salad was gorgeous. And the service was very pleasant. No complaints!  GO!

My sister is OBSESSED with this place. I'm actually not a big veggies fan, so this place was really awesome for me because it made vegan interesting. She ordered takeout one night during a visit to Montreal. I particularly enjoyed the frites. But she raves about the bowls.

As a vegan who has lived in some extremely vegan-friendly cities , Montreal's most famous vegan restaurant is nice but nothing spectacular.  The positivies are that even though it is always busy, the service is very quick and friendly. The menu is huge with something for everyone, and it is very reasonably priced.  The food itself is good but can lack flavour . The salads and bowls are large and fresh, but often rely on the (pretty good) sauces for flavour. I also have had a burger which was pretty stodgy and dry, as were the wedges that accompanied it .  The best part of my meals there are the smoothies, the creamsicle is particularly good!

This place has almost a cult following for its coconut bacon alone, but the rest of the food selections are equally rich in character, and delicious.   I've been here a couple of times and always leave stuffed and completely satisfied. It's decently affordable, too. The juices will give you *super powers* (just kidding, but it feels like that when you drink it), the servings are really substantial and there's excellent selection, whether you're vegan or not.   I've gotten chana paratha, which is an entree but was plenty enough eats for me, along with a juice (although I wasn't starving when I got there). I've also gotten the Assiette Mumbai, which was simple fare, and also really tasty and satisfying - seems I have a thing for chickpeas. Next time I go, I'm trying their famed Dragon Bowl.   Honestly, you can't go wrong here. The staff is sparkling, there's a ton of seating and you're being good to your body with every bite.

Being able to get a healthy dinner at 10 in the evening - priceless.   I go to this place whenever I am in Montreal for business and I always come for a late dinner. (Never been there before 9pm)  The staff is friendly, the food is great. I always try the soup of the day and know all the items on the menu by now. Also, the quantities of food are large, I simply love it.

I love vegan eats and Aux Vivres is a Montreal staple. I had the Aux Vivres burger and my boyfriend had the tempeh which he didn't like. The Aux Vivres burger was pretty mediocre however the ambiance and service was nice.  I probably wouldn't go back as it isn't particularly affordable on a student budget nor am I vegan. I prefer Lola Rosa!

Oh man. This place. The French Canadians really know how to make a Jewish vegan New Yorker's dream come true. Vegan lox! Do I need to say more?! My childhood...and that butter! I've tried to smoke carrots myself, but to no great end result. If I lived in Montreal, I would likely be here every day. Everything was delicious! The living salad was insanely delicious. I actually couldnt stop eating, I ate everything....Top top top vegan find ever and I have traveled everywhere in the states. Merci, MERCI!

My group of friends decided to try this place out since one of the members is a vegetarian and said that the menu looked amazing. It certainly smelled like it upon walking in, and it was surprisingly less crowded than I expected it to be, so getting a table of four was relatively easy. The menu itself was so large and diverse, so don't worry about not having any solid options because there's something for everyone.  Three of us decided to get smoothies to start, and we ordered the Tropicalia, the Blue Monkey, and the Mango Lassi (I'm not exactly sure why it's under smoothies but okay I guess???). Each of them were delectable and definitely required some sort of self-control to not drink them all at once. In addition, I got a malai kofta appetizer, and it tasted wonderfully homey and divine with the combination of chickpeas, various spices, and the sauce that they were cooked in. My friend also got the Tom Yum  soup, which I found to be flavorful, but she said that she felt they OD'd on the ginger a bit.  For our main meals, I got the Aux Vivres Burger while my friend got the Mexicali plate and the other two got the Bombay Thali. The burger was really tasty and clearly was made with fresh ingredients, but I felt that it kind of fell apart quite easily so that I was left with a quarter of the patty and one bun by the end. Also, the coleslaw wasn't the best that I've had, but they do serve up some mean roasted potato wedges that I still dream about. All of my friends seemed to like their individual plates, although my friends who had the thali didn't eat the salad on them because they don't consider it "real food" hahaha.  I skipped dessert this time, but two of my friends ordered the chocolate cake and apple pie. The chocolate cake was served in a really thick slice and was really good, but the apple pie was served in a really flat and thin slice? Both were priced the same as well.  Aux Vivres is one of the better vegan dining places I've been to in Montréal, although it can get slightly expensive. While it's by no means a completely cravings-free substitution of meat, it does a decent job of creating spinoffs of classic world dishes that are delicious in their own right.

I'm a health-conscious and open-minded omnivore with a vegetarian partner, so I've tried a lot of different vegetarian and vegan versions of things and been able to compare them with "the real thing". Sometimes they closely imitate the real thing. Sometimes they don't compare, but are still tasty. And sometimes they're a failure on the scale of Aux Vivre's veggie butter, which I think they must have really worked on to make sure it resembled actual butter in no way whatsoever. If you've ever wondered what corn bread would taste like with Asian salad dressing, Aux Vivres is for you!  Aux Vivres makes to-go food that can be found in local groceries and markets. I recently picked up the BBQ Tempeh wrap, because I'd never had BBQ tempeh I didn't love, at least until that day. Would recommend this wrap for anyone who finds tofu just too flavourful. If I had to rate this tempeh's flavour on a scale of 1-5 where 5 is a plain hard-boiled egg and 1 is the tap water at my mom's house, I might give it a 0.75.  Aux Vivres makes what my partner calls "California hippy vegan" food, the hallmarks of which are a fetishization of certain "superfoods", the vege bait-and-switch (it's just like regular butter, in the sense that both are yellow!), and a focus on the foods' health benefits at the expense of rich, full-bodied flavour. Definitely come here if you are looking for an interesting salad to Instagram, not so much if you're after comfort food.  The redeeming quality that gave this review the extra star is Aux Vivre's Dragon Bowl, specifically Dragon Sauce, of which you can get a bottle to take home. Whatever Dragon Sauce is, it is delicious, and tastes vastly more like butter than whatever's in their veggie butter.

This was a great choice for our takeout lunch. I ordered the Mumbai Thali. It was a small yet filling dish. I think I missed my salad amidst the hubbub, but scored some delicious reddish bread. Perhaps it was Paratha with slightly spicy flavors. Overall, a good meal.

Went for breakfast and then dinner on another occasion.  For breakfast I got Le Complet and it was incredible.  The best vegan food I have ever had.  My friend got the blueberry pancakes and they were lacking honestly.  The waitress had something up her butt b/c she was pretty darn rude.  For dinner the next day I got the lasagna, which was bland but the salad was awesome.  Had the banana chocolate pie for dessert, which considering it was vegan was quite good.  Really impressed by the coconut crust. Service that night was great and made up for the other experience.

Superbe découverte de ce restaurant vegan. Mon 1er restaurant de ce genre.  Les plats sont relativement copieux et raisonnable en terme de prix.  J'ai pris le sandwich sirocco à base d'aubergine grillée, houmous, poivrons rouges rôti, laitue et tapenade d'olives le tout enveloppé d'une feuille de chapati. J'ai vraiment aimé ce mélange.  Ce que j'ai adoré c'est le smoothie blue monkey à base de bleuets, banane, jus d'orange et agave, miam une tuerie ! Et n'oublions pas la tarte choco-banane vraiment excellente.   Le service est très rapide nous avons attendu une 15aine de minutes avant d'être servi, c'est génial.   Penser à réserver car il y a beaucoup de monde et ce restaurant est fameux pour tous les vegan et les autres !

Ambiance décontractée et service rapide ! Plat copieux et coloré! Les enfants ont adorés !  La qualité de la nourriture ainsi que la diversité seront plaire pour tous. Les néophytes dans la bouffe végé seront également conquis et surpris!!!

Since I'm GLUTEN and DAIRY free, this is seriously the only place where I can confidently dine at in Montreal while knowing I won't feel a little off the next day. I frequent AV around once a month but now that it's getting nice out I'll make the walk here probably once a week. It's the closest I can be to eating at home if not healthier. They take cross contamination and food allergies seriously and their food is just plain healthy, which makes for a healthy Yelper.  My favorite dishes here are the small house and the BLT Caesar. Their lentil soup has been hit or miss but I'm not sure if it's the soup or me (sometimes I am pickier than other times if you know what I mean)  I love their thick cut roasted potato wedges, smoothies, and gluten free desserts too!  Gluten free and Dairy free Montreal peeps PLEASE PM ME with any similar restaurants that have no cross contamination like these guys do. I'm at a loss but this seems to be it for me thus far. Help me out y'all.

Had blueberry pancakes. We're a little light, but very good overall. My GF had huevos rancheros. Those were excellent.   Also had mango lassi. Very good. So was fresh OJ.  Server disappeared for a while. So took 20 mins or so to get our check.

This is one of my favorite restaurants hands down. Even if you're not big into vegan food, you will enjoy this place. The Thai bowl is very delicious with a great combination of raw ingredients like the carrot and lettuce and the warm like the rice. The peanut sauce tops it off quite nicelty. The service is great, ask for Melissa.

We tried the SANDWICH SERVED IN CHAPATI, it wasn't good at all, it was so salty I couldn't finish it, they put way too much sauce in it.  The price is WAY WAY too expensive for a non-meat meal, it's basically a pita wrap with lettuce, nuts, tofu, spices and a yucky sauce, $11 for that? Really? We had two of those with 2 ginger ale, it was almost $40.. WOW..   The service was awful too, we were served by a girl that didn't give a f**k. I guess we interrupted her afternoon nap, since the place was mostly empty on a Saturday.  When I left I felt ripped off, I can't believe that so many people recommended this place.. Montreal has some really low standards.

Very delicious, fresh, vegan, awesome food.  The service was very friendly, attentive, and really fast.  Not only is the food great, but there is also a variety of cool teas to go along with it.  Decent portions and again very fresh. Relatively inexpensive.  There's an awesome seating area ouside in the back.  Also, I discovered you can catch very fast WIFI in there, so if you're looking for sweet sweet internet you'll find it here as well.  CLOSED MONDAY.
Get everything.  Seriously, the food is outstanding.  The smoothies and juices are ridiculously good.  The soups and sandwiches are just amazing, too.  I forgot it was vegan.

This place is super cute. I think they have a good selection on their vegetarian menu. They give a hefty portion so be prepared to get  a doggie bag or bring your appetite. Their wait-staff are bilingual which is great & so is their menu. Check it out,because it is delicious.

Save room for dessert on this review.  * * *  This is a vegan restaurant with lumberjack portions.  One meal here and you will not have to eat again all  day.  Individual dishes range between four and five stars.  I had an absolutely first rate vegan chili - with soy cream and lots of garnishes and a lot of high quality tortilla chips.  The bowl was the size of half a bowling ball.  The chili substantially exceeded Texas chili standards - and I should know being a Texan.  Vegan chili has no meat and meat is the essence of a successful chili.  Most vegan chili has to work hard to qualify for "that's nice dear".  This was the real Texas stuff and was a downright pleasure to eat  Even if no cow was actually hurt in the making of this production.  * * *  My wife's Thai bowl was just okay.  This was another half-bowling-ball bowl filled with grains, tempeh, and vegetables cut too large to conveniently get in your mouth and eat.  Flavor? Meh.  * * *  A first course of gazpacho was better than Health Food Store Gazpacho and worse than Barcelona Gazpacho.   Nearly every health food store makes a gazpacho in the summer, and they may as well call it  "Cold and Insipid Tomato Soup - But Eat It - Its Good For You".  This was better than that.    It had good tomatoes.   It had personality.   It had its own non-standard taste.   (I suspect a serrano pepper was lurking in the background).  It had cilantro which I personally can't stand.  But the vegan at the table who came with me to insure fair judgment of cilantro dishes   Told me that - even giving the cilantro a break - the soup wasn't that great.  Give it a B.  * * *  Now for the accomplishment of this kitchen.  Dessert.  One of the dishes is a chocolate apple cake.  This is a purely vegan cake with zucchini as a binder and flaxseed taking the place of egg.  There are a lot of vegan restaurants that try dishes of this ilk.  The result tends to be a sodden heavy mess.  In contrast, this was an intriguing fascinating dessert.  The apple taste was very subtle but it was there, giving the cake lightness and personality.  The cake was delightfully moist.  It had fascinating flavor.  Is it as good as a cake from the finest patisserie in Paris?   No.  But it leaves Moosewood and Rainbow Collective and Casa de Luz cakes far back in the pack.  I admire the technical skill of the baker of working out the exact proportions of these recondite ingredients to make the cake a textural and flavor success.  * * *  So if you need to eat your healthy vegetables, this is a great place to do it.  Zucchini in your main course.  Zucchini in your dessert.

Shame on me for not coming here sooner. The truth is though, I thought this place was a militant vegan place that would smell the seafood-eating fear in me if I dared to walk through the place. (I'm serious) It turned out to be this sunny looking place with abundant seating.  Unlike others I was with, who favoured the revered dragon bowl, I wanted to venture out and got me a Macro Bowl. It was delish but I admit, I like seaweed (wakame) in its natural state and then they had me at the miso-tahini sauce, which is a super combo in my opinion.  We ordered a banana chocolate pie to split, and as a crust-head (yes I've coined a new term for those who enjoy crust) it was yummy, pie was a bit too sweet but the smooth and creaminess was very WOW, and I am glad that we split it four ways, otherwise, I would have been groaning the way home.   One of the best parts of the meal I think is how awesome the server was, I don't know her name, but she was not only attentive to our water needs, but she was friendly and non-pushy.  She also was honest about her favourites when asked, and seemed very genuine. We also had a baby at the table, and she provided the baby chair thingy no questions asked, (can you tell I wasn't the mother? hahaha "thingy").  Overall I had a lovely time here, and will definitely come back for MOAR!  Rumour also has it that they have a beautiful terrace, but I didn't venture there.

Delicious vegan food right in the middle of the plateau. Although I'm not a fan of the lighting (very fluorescent and uncomfortable), the food is really good. My favorite is the chili on potatoes, served with a cashew cream cheese. So delicious! Their brunch blueberry pancakes are also very good, though I wish they had a bigger brunch section!
One of my favourite Vegan places to eat in Montreal! The absolute best is the Dragon Bowl - it will become an addiction!
Very refreshing and tasty food, I always go to this place whenever I can. My favorite things to order is the BLT,the dragon bowl and the carrot cake.

Wow! Very happy to have found this place. It seems like in Montreal all the vegetarian/vegan places are insanely expensive for what's actually put on the plate. This place, on the other hand, satisfies every bit of hunger I have for under $13.   That aside, it's actually really really tasty and they have plenty of options. It's worth trying and ill definitely be taking some friends there!

Pour calmer la folie végan de Laura on est venu tester un repas dans ce restaurant qui jouis d'une bonne réputation. Nous avons pris le brunch qui vient servis avec un chai latté ou du café. Le chai était assez intense au niveau épice. C'était dans la partie supérieur pour ma part, plus ça coupe trop le gout de la boisson ! Au niveau du plat mes huevos rancheros étaient bien bons, une bonne portion qui m'a permis de tenir jusqu'au soir. J'ai adoré les patates douces avec la petite sauce qui va bien. le guacamole était bon. On a aussi pris un smoothie au fruit qui était bon et aussi un peu épicé ce qui rehaussé le gout des fruits. Satisfait de notre repas, le service est correct. A tester pour d'autres plats dont notamment le gâteau au fromage qui semble assez bon :)

We ate brunch on a Saturday morning at Aux Vivres during a short trip to Montreal. We sat in the back garden, which was really nice. Loved seeing basil and tomatoes growing in their boxes instead of fancy flowers. My bf and I shared the waffles and the polenta cakes brunch options - and both were very very good. We loved the cashew cream and fruit topping that came with the waffles. Normally I hate polenta anything, but their's was delicious, as was the guac that came with it. My only minor complaint would be that the black beans not be pureed, but served whole, but the dish was still good. The mango lassi we had was excellent - not too sweet, and with yummy pieces of real fruit in it! We also tried the coconut "bacon" on the side, out of curiosity - it was interesting and nice - it would have been great as part of a trail mix. My bf (who is not vegan) said the waffles were one of the best brunches he'd had anywhere. The prices ($10-$11 per brunch plate, which included coffee!) and service was also fantastic. If we get to Montreal again, we will definitely go back.

For years we have gone to Montreal only to strike out finding any decent vegetarian options.  Finally, someone told us to check out Aux Vivres and it was so worth it.  Clean, classy & a great variety of veg & vegan fare.  This is a must check out & worth going to the mile end for the shops that are also around it!

Came here end of August with my surprisingly open-minded father (furthest thing from vegan)! I loved it. I got the Thai bowl with tofu which was served with a delicious peanut sauce and brown rice. My dad tried the Tempeh satay sticks with peanut sauce and the cornbread with veggie butter and guacamole. He loved the cornbread, not so much the tempeh (but I think as a meat eater he might have been put off)! Overall I loved it! And I'll be back :)
Le restaurant est toujours plein et la nourriture est toujours bonne. Parfait restaurant pour un soir de semaine.

Delicious food and a great atmosphere. Additional pre-made items in the refrigerator make this a great stop for lunch and snacks to get you to your next destination hanger (hungry anger) free. Had the seitan gyro and a can of Yerba mate tea. it was filling and delicious. No regrets.

Came here for a lunch on a Sunday around 11:30am- surprisingly no major line up!  We ate: - Mexicali plate (3/5): the guac was awesome, but the chilli was cold and lacking the wow factor. A+ tortilla! - Portobelo mushroom burger (3/5): While the mushroom itself was delish, the toppings and potatoes left more to be desired. - Fresh apple juice : (4/5) umm 6$?  Overall it was okay,  but I could find these dishes at other non-speciality Restos and it would be probably better.   Ps. Upon leaving at 1ish there was a crazy line!!!

Outstanding food, sensational service, and superb company made this a place to remember.  The staff is friendly, efficient, and generous with the coffee, and even the most finicky eater will find a favourite here.   I had a Bombay banane smoothie to start, with sweet dates and spicy ginseng blended with cream soy coconut milk.  Indulgent yet light, and the perfect accompaniment to a generous portion of chick pea curry that I inhaled whilst awaiting my friends.  The curry was savoury and nourishing, and could easily satisfy a lunch time craving by itself.    I had a Bouddha bowl for my entrée, and it was more than I could eat even if I'd begun on an empty stomach, so yay for leftovers!  The vegetables were perfectly steamed and crisp, with an excellent Japanese sauce that blended well with the fresh veggies and brown rice as well.    My friends shared a stunning cornbread starter with vegan butter, and fresh green salad, and BLT that quite honestly made me wish I'd heeded their advice. Arriving on a fresh chapati, the layers of juicy tomatoes, verdant lettuce, vegan mayonnaise, and coconut bacon, had me transfixed on what I could only imagine to be the best tasting vegan sandwich ever.  My friends seemed to know, yet didn't offer even a single bite.  Well played.

Mais assez décue dans l'ensemble... Je m'attendais à beaucoup premièrement parce que j'achète leurs produits quand je fais mon épicerie et je les trouve très bons, deuxièmement parce que j'en avais entendu du bien. Peut être que j'en attendais trop, mais ca n'a pas vraiment fonctionné avec moi. En revanche, ca ne m'empêchera pas de continuer à acheter leurs produits.  J'ai choisi les pancakes et honnêtement je les ai trouvé ratés. Bien trop secs et fades à mon goût. De plus, l'accompagnement est minimaliste, je trouve que pour le prix ca mériterait un peu plus de choses.   Le service est correct, ni plus ni moins.  Je n'ai pas vécu ca comment une expérience extraordinaire et il y a peu de chance pour que j'y retourne un jour, pour y manger sur place en tout cas.  Si je mets 3 étoiles, c'est grâce à leurs produits que j'achète en épicerie uniquement

It's odd that I haven't reviewed Aux Vivres yet. Maybe in an alternate universe I did, but anyway, just to make sure I'd like to note that the bright clean design, the light wood benches, the relaxed funny staff, the leafy back terrasse and convenient takeout counter are all soul soothing. Most welcome though is the hit of fresh, healthy, and tasty always to be found here.   The dragon bowl and vegan bacon are my usual picks, but my personal highlight is the creamsicle smoothie. Coconut juice and all manner of healthy things winningly combined to taste exactly like those orangey ice creamsicles you remember from sunny kid days at Grandmas (If you don't have this memory you can borrow mine and then go to Aux Vivres to re-live it. I hope you enjoy!)

I've been to Aux Vivres more times than I can count. One of fave restaurants!  The first time I went I was less than impressed. My bill was $40 and it included an appetizer, main, dessert and drink; I disliked everything! I ordered the kosmos plate which came with a salad that had literally no dressing - that, and the blandness of it all, is what everyone assumes to be vegan cuisine.  I couldn't get over all the positive reviews so went again, and ordered different things - can't get enough of it   - Sandwiches are awesome... the gyro pita is amazing. Have never had such great tzatziki!  - Best chilli - so flavourful. Love the vegan sour cream and guacamole on top - LOVE their brunches. Wow. So filling and so much for the $ - be warned there are line ups on the weekend for brunch  - Take out counter is awesome. You can buy their cakes at reasonable prices (carrot cake - amazing)  - Service is prompt and friendly   Of course there's areas for improvement: renovations are really due - booths, chairs, etc very very out of date.   If you went and didn't like it, try it again, try something different - awesome

I've been here twice already and I have nothing but love for this little place.   I think I may have actually dreamed about their roasted cornbread. It's hearty and slightly spicy served with a vegan butter sauce. I recommend this in combination with the GIANT veggie chili served with guacamole. It keeps very well overnight.   Their macro bowl is also particularly good. It is a cleverly conceived combination of fresh organic veggies over steamed brown rice. To my taste, I think this dish could be improved (ever so slightly) with some enoki mushrooms, but I'm not sure how those fly with the macro lifestyle.    As for the ambiance, I very much enjoy their summer patio. They've done very nicely with it.

I love love love the food here! If I lived in Montreal this would be my go-to place for everything. After partying it up super hard - this is the place you wanna go where your body is just going to vaccuum up all the nutrients it lost the night before. Electrolyte love! My body is like a dry shriveled up sponge when I come here and I just suck everything up till I'm wet... wait a sec... this food porn thing is going a little far.  I am back home in Vancouver, WISHING we had a place like this, where you can get yummy veggie food and have decent service, and not pay an arm and a leg to get it. I am already looking forward to my next trip to Montreal in September so I can gorge all I want and not leave feeling like I do right now after this festive seasonal break people call Christmas. All I got for Christmas this year was fat, but that's just more of me to love less!

I just feel good eating here. It's a bit pricey for me, but I can tell everything I've ordered is made with quality ingredients (and it's good for me!) Being a bacon lover, I was a little skeptical of the BLT since the bacon is replaced by smoked coconut but once I tried it, I never looked back. I went with a group of both vegetarians and non-vegetarians, and everyone left happy. Favourite dish: BLT Favourite juice: the Popeye
This vegan joint is truly a treat.   The food is decidedly delicious, and the service is truly outstanding.

I love this place and I'm not even vegan. I'm no where near vegan but I leave here completely satisfied. The service, the food and the price are fantastic. My 9 yr old daughter loves it too. I may become vegan if all the V food tastes this good.... Well probably not but I can contemplate it now without getting the shivers. So eat here and enjoy feeling almost vegan. I have a false sense of vegan smugness that is completely temporary but good.
We were visiting Montreal for a long weekend. After trying brunch on the first day we came back every day after! The chai was delicious and the pancakes were the best I've ever had!
Slouvlaki tempeh sandwich was not my jam. Carrot cake had a bit of a strange flavour. Not my favourite vegan carrot cake. The banana chocolate cake was delicious.

When traveling, it's always hard to find great healthy food that's easy to grab and go.   In Montreal - Aux Vivres is not only a great place for good food, but a must try if you even remotely like vegetables. Their Dragon Bowl was amazing. Great mix of veggies with brown rice.   The food was so good I picked up a bunch on my way bag for my veggie roommate. She's now in love with their veggie burgers, so it looks like I'll have to head back to Montreal shortly to bring more great vegan food back home.
Auz vivres ! Un bon classique, toujours agréable lorsqu'on a envie d'un bon repas végétarien et savoureux !

Bombay banana smoothie was very interesting, pretty good, but my sister absolutely loves it. It contains banana and chocolate but is strongly spicy, tasting of masala and ginger. Malai kofta balls were good, also spicy.   Now...the real thing... Dragon sandwich with grilled tempeh is DA REAL BOMB!! 5 stars on the very first bite. Huge portions, fresh ingredients, and warm bread wrap. Normally not a big fan of tempeh, but it was absolutely fantastic here.  Great, friendly service.

Everything is very innovative and fresh.  There's a huge variety on the menu, with creative combinations and uses of vegetarian ingredients, and the selection goes beyond anything I've seen at vegetarian places in the Southern California area.  The place is casual, so service is minimal but very pleasant.  Vegetables are crunchy, sauces aren't too heavy.  Portions are very generous, and prices are reasonable despite that it's vegan/vegetarian.  I'd recommend the BLT type of wrap, which has lots of flavors and textures going on. Soup was also really tasty and satisfying on a cold November day.  I'd definitely recommend it for vegetarians and non vegetarians alike.

Depuis le temps que je me délectais du bol dragon, en vente dans différentes boutiques à Montréal, comme au marché Maisonneuve par exemple, il me tardait de découvrir plus de recettes au restaurant. C'est un dimanche matin que nous décidâmes d'y venir prendre le brunch et ce fut un réel succès! Sur 4 convives, chacun prit un plat différent et tous étaient délicieux, les jus, café et thé également.  Et pour ceux qui sont accro au tempeh, la boutique d'à côté vous propose pas mal de produits vegan, bio etc... Une façon originale de cuisiner chez vous comme "Aux Vivres". Arrivez tôt, l'ouverture est à 10h le dimanche, car la salle se remplit très très vite, au point que lorsque nous sommes parti, la file d'attente allait jusqu'au dehors. Une adresse que je recommande à tous, vegan ou non, vous serez conquis!

Un incontournable pour tous les végétariens: du burrito matin, au BLT, au jus d'orange fraîchement pressé, même mes amis carnivores y trouvent leur compte! De plus, je reçois un service rapide à chaque visite Le magasin "Pour Emporter" collé sur le restaurant est mon arrêt #1 pour de la bouffe sur le pouce. Aux Vivres revend même quelques uns des ses plats préparés dans différents marchés de la ville. Dieu merci.  La seule chose qui manque est une terrasse.
This place is so amazing! The vegan food is so delicious and everything just melts in your mouth. Just delectable and always busy for a reason.

I'd give this place 3.5 stars if I can.  I'm not a vegetarian, but I love my vegetables enough that I am very happy when I see a vegan restaurant.  I got the tofu dragon bowl (tofu, daikon, shredded vegetable with brown rice).  I wish they'd mix the vegetable a bit more.  It came in a bowl (duh), but it was somewhat hard to eat as there were a lot of shredded vegetable falling off.  So I ended up eating a lot of carrots at once, cabbage another time, etc.  Nothing extraordinary about the vegetable.  The sauce with brown rice was good though.  My friend had the tofu burger, and she wasn't too pleased with it.  Another friend got the cornbread with veggie butter and the curry cauliflower soup.  They were both very filling, and she didn't care for the pepper in the cornbread.  It wasn't bad, but it wasn't spectacular.  The waitress was really slow with our service.

Went here twice, and had two very different experiences! The first time the service was fast and the staff were kind, however the second time I was disappointed. They have a great selection of sandwiches, salads and rice bowls. Fast and comforting food with options for anyone!

Great food! Loved it a lot! Wish there would be more gluten free options tho. Staff was friendly and super nice. It takes time to prepare healthy food people so don't bit..h about the waiting. Can't wait to come back yum yum

Came here for brunch on the weekend, which was busy. I got the yogurt with granola. It was my first time trying nondairy yogurt, and it was actually really good. I would definitely go for one of the veggie bowls next time, which was what my friend got and it looked so good. I also got a mango smoothie; I was hoping that the smoothie was thicker though.

I was so excited to try Aux Vivres during my week in Montreal. My dad and I did takeout for an early dinner one night. Luckily there was no line and the service was quick and friendly. I ordered the BLT on their dark bread and a slice of carrot cake. The portions were surprisingly huge. The coconut bacon was delicious after the first couple bites, but then it made my stomach a little uneasy. Still the sandwich was tasty and I loved the mayo. The carrot cake was a little too moist and the frosting didn't look fresh, but it was still pretty good. My dad really enjoyed the vegie pate sandwich and he's not even a vegetarian!   I wish I could have tried more of their interesting sandwiches/bowls. I'd definitely come back if returning to Montreal.

I have never been to the restaurant itself as me and my roommate have only been ordering online, but I cannot wait to find the time to actually go there. We have a bad habit of ordering food when we're tired instead of cooking (really, ask our banker, he's not very happy with us right now) but we are still trying to maintain a healthy lifestyle. We were very happy to find Aux Vivres and it has become our undisputed food provider for lazy days, and for others too.   We are both vegan and it can sometimes be tricky to find good, fresh and healthy food for a reasonable price. Now I won't say Aux Vivres is cheap, but the food is worth the price, and we have not been disappointed once. Not once! And we've tried a lot of different things, from their burgers to their sandwiches, their specialties to their desserts, and even their brunch! (You can tell we have a lot of "lazy days", I'm not even ashamed)  I have to say, one of the best thing about Aux Vivres is that even if it is considered a "trendy" place, your grandmother would still approve of the portions (you know, the one who keeps saying that you need to "put some meat on those bones")! I had a hard time finishing the sandwich in one sitting, and you can be sure that every single item on the menu will probably fill you up! (One thing to remember when you want to order dessert, take something on the lighter side before! And no, not the sandwich!)  We would recommend the Chili Fries, the Vege Burger and their brownies, especially for non-vegans eating there! Otherwise, everything else is absolutely delicious and it mostly depends on your personal tastes!
Stumbled upon this gem after a road-race - absolutely delicious!!!
