Tried twice and it disappointed again. The fresh juices were the best things on the menu. I'm vegetarian and this did not really cut it for us. The Dahl soup was so watered down that it didn't taste like much. Just murky water. The chili tasted like they just threw a can of red beans and a can of tomatoes plus some chili powder and they warmed it up for 5 min. Three quarter of the wrap was lettuce the rest was marinated carrots. Service was friendly at first but once we got our food she never came back until the end and the place was not busy. There is potential here but I find that they need to put a bit of love in their cooking. Try Lola Rosa which is hands down the best vegetarian restaurant in Montreal in my opinion.

Ce restaurant végétalien est bien connu et se passe de présentation. Pourtant, je n'y avait jamais mis les pieds. C'est chose du passé, car j'y suis allée avec mon fils.   Ai essayé le bol Dragon (luzerne, pousses de tournesol, betteraves, carottes, choux rouge, tofu grillé et riz brun) le tout, bien arrosé de leur sauce dragon. Un délice, même mon fils a grignoté la salade avec moi! Essayez les jus fraîchement pressés! Celui aux pommes, citron et gingembre était très intense... en gingembre et fort en bouche. Par contre, ça réveille un homme!   Vous n'avez pas une minute à perdre? Essayez leur comptoir prêt--à--manger. Comme quoi on peut manger sainement, même sur le pouce et à prix raisonnable!

My wife and I recently traveled to Montreal and since she has gluten and dairy allergies this place looked like the it would be great for a visit. We stopped in sometime between 1-2pm on a Monday and it was still kinda busy. This place has a lot going for it. It's got a pretty decent size, lots of choices on the menu, friendly wait staff. Normally I would be giving this place a much higher review.  The reason for the low review is this: After sitting without any water or any word from a waiter or waitress for I thought too long a time, one arrived and I ordered the Chili Frites (without sour cream) I believe it was called. The menu said it was "roasted potatoes with house chili and sour cream". I was expecting a type of chili topped poutine, or a type of chili cheese fries. What I got instead was a big bowl of chili with carrot shredded to look like cheddar cheese and guacamole. Absolutely no sign of potato. It came in a generous portion but, without any warning from the waitress, it was served so incredibly hot that when I took my first bite I immediately burned the end of my tongue. Not hot as in spicy but hot as in temperature. I actually spit it out before it could burn my whole mouth. This was the first day of a week long visit and the last thing I wanted was for everything I would be eating to taste like rubber. In an attempt to cool it down I began to stir it and blow on it trying to cool it down. In doing so I stirred the little strings of carrot into it which began to cook it was so hot and when it finally cooled enough to eat, the carrot had a very off putting texture being 3/4 of the way cooked, not quite the softness of cooked carrots and not the crispness of raw carrot but somewhere in between and unappetizing. I ended up taking maybe three bites before I gave up.  The good news is the waitress boxed it up for me and I ate it for dinner that night. Truth be told it was one of the better things I ate while in Canada, unlike other things I ate on my trip, it was nicely seasoned. However, between the long wait, burn on my tongue, lack of potatoes, and unpleasant texture I can only give my experience 2 stars.

J'adore "Aux Vivres".  En plus d'y manger santé, les plats sont tous savoureux et colorés.  Un must SANTÉ à Montréal. Ils ont maintenant un comptoir/épicerie pour emporter. Quel bonheur!  Le bol du dragon est formidable! Et le pad thai, wow!   On y retourne sans hésiter, et ce, régulièrement! MIAM! :)

Had the dragon bowl for lunch and it was delicious and beautifully presented! They gave me a heaping portion of extra sauce when I asked for it, no charge! The bowl itself is fairly simple, you can easily make it at home and I believe they sell the sauce. The place was pretty busy at lunch time but the service was still quick.

We were greeted by a very pleasant waitress the moment we stepped in. I like that you have the option to either sit in the restaurant or in the cafe. We stuck with the cozy booth seating. The interior is very clean and I loved the art that was hanging up. I even walked around the restaurant to look at the prints.  The souvlaki-style seitan and tzatziki were fantastic! The vinaigrette on the salad was a bit too strong, but the seitan, cut in thick 'meaty' chunks, was flavoured nicely. The soy chai latte was tasty but could have been a bit bigger. My friend devoured her chili. The only disappointment was that her dish was served lukewarm.   I just wish that the brunch was available on weekdays; I'll have to try it the next time I'm in town.   Solid all around.

This place was amazing. The food was great and the menu had a wide range of options, inspired by Indian, Greek, Thai, Chinese and Mediterranean cuisines, to name a few. I had the Sirocco wrap, which was okay, and my boyfriend had the Dragon bowl, which was awesome. I was pretty jealous. I wish I'd tried the BLT -- it's got good reviews here, and a good vegan BLT is so hard to find.

[Montreal Food Tour Stop #8]  A great selection of vegan food, which not only includes salads but also juices, smoothies, tempeh, tofu, burgers made from tempeh or tofu, alcoholic beverages, and rice bowls.  I needed something healthy to counter all of the poutine, pastries, and desserts that I had been eating in Montreal.  This restaurant isn't quite in downtown, but it was worth the cab ride from downtown.  It's nice to be pleasantly full, but still comfortable because the food is all relatively healthy.  Highlights: I ordered the tempeh burger, which comes with a vegan coleslaw and a side of potato wedges.  It's been a long time since I've had tempeh, and that last experience was in a college dining hall.   Eating the tempeh burger here gave me a fresh perspective - that a vegan burger patty can actually taste good.  The patty (more shaped like a rectangular slab) was very moist, unlike the first time I ate tempeh.  There was a tasty spread on the sandwich.  I liked how the burger was served with potato wedges instead of fries.  The vegan coleslaw was very light.   Critiques: Bread for the burger was just okay, in my opinion.  I also ordered a mango lassi, which was decent but average.  The drink tasted differently from what you would get at an Indian restaurant.  Overall: If you're vegan, this place is awesome.  Carnivores may still prefer real meat over the vegan burgers, but the dishes were well executed and a nice change of pace from fried food and buttery pastries.

This was just an okay meal for us on our trip to Montreal.  We went for lunch and the food was too heavy on sprouts without enough dressing or flavor.  The breakfast foods look more promising.  The staff was fine, just nothing that stood out to us above average.
Yum! Great food. Reasonable prices. Long hours. Need anything else? My two favorite dishes are the pancakes and the lasagna (take out only). So tasty!
Amazing vegan food, can't say enough about it.  One of the few places in Montreal I can go to and know that I can order anything from the menu.  Excellent!

I guess this place needs no more PR, but we really had a great experience here.  Awesome curious menu with so much variety to choose from. All vegan, all specially made and unique enough to warrant trying. I am not vegan and it all looked really appetizing. Not bad prices either.  Got their with gf about 5pm on a Saturday. Super nice server, which surprised me as I expected passive aggressive judgmental vegans, to a degree. Ordered lentil soup, veggie pate. Both were just awesome. I had a burger, and gf had the BLT. BLT is huge, but as close and amazing to a real BLT I had ever tasted. Really good. And my burger was really good too. Though it left me with that full vegan burger feeling for a while after. We also had two Kombuchas.  Everything tasted really unique and GOOD. I'm not vegan, but if I could figure out how to cook like that, then shit I'd probably give up meat in no time.   Really great stuff. Had a great experience and will definitely go back.

The food was very good and I would suggest this restaurant. I like food that doesn't taste as healthy and I have had better raw food, like Pure Food and Wine in New York City. For the price and taste, I rate Aux Vivres a 4.

I had been wanting to go to Aux Vivres for years, and after the build-up, the disappointment seemed inevitable. Now, I don't like either rice or tempeh, of course being a vegan establishment, most of their menu is based on both. Sadface!  I wanted to maximize the variety of food and eat something warm, so I ordered the cornbread, a small chilli bowl, a creamsicle smoothie and a side of coconut bacon. The cornbread is not really an appetizer, it's massive, 4 sticks of bread + sauce! Umf. It's surprisingly sweet, with peppers baked in. Not at all what I expected since I come from a garlic cornbread background. The chilli was good, but not remarkable. Now the side of vegan bacon is pretty massive. Delicious, crispy, actually close to bacon in flavour, but sooo salty! I'd actually recommend not ordering it at your table and instead buying it at their store, it's a lot cheaper.  The smoothie was the highlight of my meal, and made a fantastic dessert: the taste is exactly that of an orange creamsicle, but with only vegan goodness inside.  The space is beautiful, and surprisingly homey, that being said, my waitress was surly and oddly avoidant. Minus points! I left ridiculously full, and a bit miffed. They do seem to have delicious desserts, so I guess that'd be a nice occasion to change my mind..

Cute little vegetarian / vegan restaurant.  I personally am a true meat-eater, I'm all about steaks and hamburgers, but that doesn't mean I can't enjoy some vegetarian delights every once in a while (that and my friends wanted to go and I didn't want to be Debbie Downer)  I started with a apple / ginger / lemon juice which was ok, but not great.  I wound up leaving half of it and just continuing with water.  Maybe had I been a bit more adventurous then I would have liked something else better?  My sandwich (the Sirocco - eggplant, humus, olive tapenade) was excellent.  It was a bit too creamy, but with those types of ingredients what do you expect.  My friend got the BLT, which is made with coconut bacon, and I wasn't that impressed.  Would have preferred the real thing in that situation!   The decor was a bit of a snooze-fest, vinyl booths and regular ol' tables and chairs.  All in all an average experience, but I'd go back again and try something else next time.

Nice little diner-type place that is very popular - Montreal must be teaming with veggie-people (and here I thought it was the land of smoked meat!)  The menu was heavy on the tofu, which I'm not a fan of in general, but the hummus and smoothies were both very good.  The staff & patrons are a bit on the alternative side, so get ready to show your tattoos off.  Overall, a cool spot that I'm sure is 7th heaven for true vegans.

I am by no means vegetarian or vegan but I really enjoyed this place. I had the dragon bowl. The sauce was soooo great! Meal wasn't too expensive and I even had the "Gateaux au Faux-mage" or Uncheesecake.   Very good food :)

Aux vivres is a classic vegan/vegetarian restaurant with many delicious meals. As you walk in no matter the time of day it always seems to be PACKED! It's located north of st laurent. Easy street meter parking. The atmosphere is very "homey" and healthy. A lot of hipster/hippie people my kind of resto. It feels like a dinner but an upscale one.   I usually get one of their bowls this time I had their popular dragon bowl with tofu. DEELICIOUS. I got the tempeh before but it feels very dry and sandy and you can taste the soy bean powder after taste. You can't go wrong with the tofu. Their vinaigrette is to die for. I also shared their chilli and nachos. Loveeeeee the guacamole oh mahh goodness was it amazing. I love coming here it makes me feel Sain and healthy. They also serve alcohol but its very limited. They only have 3 cocktails on the menu and I tried the mimosa hmm kind of regret it :/ it was super sourish and bitter with freshly squeezed orange though.   Service wise: very slow at times but its understandable with the amount of orders they need to handle. The waitress was super friendly and patient. She really catered to us and came around often.   Overall, you cant go wrong with aux vivres its a fantastic little gem in the mile end of montreal fabulous and will definitely be back when I feel like being healthy again ahaha

LOVED it.  Amazing Vegan food, huge portions, good prices.    The place is super crowded, we went for Sunday brunch, and luckily found a seat.  The service was super quick (if not a bit rushed, but I get it, they were busy), food came quickly, and service was good.   No complaints here.  I had the big breakfast with tempeh bacon, tofu scramble, cornbread and sweet potatoes.  Very filling, and kept me energetic and going all day.  What a treat to have the creamer be soy creamer!!  Very exciting to be able to pour cream in my coffee!!  Very exciting to find a Vegan restaurant in Montreal!!

With my relatively new vegetarian preferences, I'll try just about any restaurant with tempeh on the menu. Aux Vivres rewarded me nicely.  Great rice bowls, sandwiches, smoothies, and desserts! Food portions were just right for me. I loved the BLT, buddha bowl, thai bowl, bombay banana, mango lassi, and chocolate smoothie. Food disappointments were the veggie lox sandwich (done well but not something I would normally crave) and the cafe frappe (the flavor wasn't quite right for some reason; maybe too much soy milk).  During my recent vacation in Montreal, I sat at various times at the counter, in the dining room, and on the terrace. I visited for both lunch and dinner, and never had to wait, although the dining room was often near capacity. The interior of the restaurant is nice, although the layout is quirky, and one of our tables was right below an air conditioner that gave us the chills. The servers were almost consistently friendly, and service was quick.

If I lived in Montreal I would eat here every day and I would be broke! Ordered the dragon bowl with tofu to go, thoroughly enjoyed it and the serving size was very generous but it was still about $14 after taxes which is a little pricey.

Une adresse à tester à Montréal, peu importe son régime alimentaire !  Je suis allée chez Aux Vivres pour bruncher un dimanche matin vers 11h30 avec deux amies. Première bonne nouvelle : pas d'attente.  La carte est vaste, il n'est pas évident de faire son choix car de nombreux plats ont l'air très alléchants (bowls, sandwichs, salades et autres) - je vais donc devoir y retourner pour satisfaire ma curiosité !   Je me suis laissée tenter par le brunch "Huevos Rancheros" avec tortillas, haricots noirs, patates douces, tofu brouillés et guacamole. C'était délicieux, frais, copieux et plein de saveurs. Le tout pour $12,95 avec un café bio ou thé chaï, donc très raisonnable.  J'ai également goûté les crêpes (pancakes) aux bleuets d'une amie, la texture était satisfaisante mais le goût de lait de soja était un peu trop présent à mon goût. Côté jus de fruits frais, j'ai beaucoup aimé le Tonique (pomme, citron, gingembre) qui porte bien son nom. En revanche, je ne recommande pas le Popeye à moins qu'on ait envie de boire du concombre pressé.
was amazingly delicious and i'm not vegan! i just felt so healthy but full eating there! the place is kooky and casual... need to go back

Really good, different food. Highly recommend the mezze aux vivres and the chile! The tom yum soup wasn't the typical tom yum but still tasted very good.   The food arrives very very quickly and service made the experience even better as everyone was pleasant to talk too!

I'm definitely a fan of this place. I will certainly make it a habit to stop by every time I find myself in Montreal.   They do an excellent vegan brunch (a very good tofu scramble). And the dragon bowl is pretty good (would like to see the tofu marinated). But all in all a great place. The whole experience was pleasant both times I've gone. No matter how busy they are, the staff never rushes you.  Great atmosphere, great staff and great food.

I admit I was a little wary of this place, which is ridiculous as I'm a vegetarian. But then I read the menu, walked in to a cute diner-y looking room with great art and music, and had a wonderful meal. It was so freeing knowing I could have anything on the menu. My little girl loved it too. Granted, she spent the whole time sucking down a mango lassi and eating a wee bit of cornbread. I did wish there were a few kid friendly options. I'm excited that we'll be here another day, so we can go back.

31% of Indians are vegetarian, yet for some reason it's hard to find incredible Indian food that's vegetarian in Montreal without it just being "yeah we took the chicken out and added, I don't know, cauliflower?"  Finally I found it at Aux Vivres. I realise I'm going to sound like a total hippy here, but I was looking for a light vegetarian lunch before my acupuncture appointment (I have anxiety, and it seemed like it might help.)  I ordered the starter Chana Paratha and a side of potato wedges with chipotle mayo.   The Chana Paratha was thick and incredibly flavourful, with more spice than I was expecting. I was glad to see it wasn't watery or weak, but instead, hearty and delicious, full of chickpeas and peas, and very filling for a $6.50 small meal.   The wedges were good, with a light vegan mayo that was a little less thick than egg mayo but still basically the same thing (you can even buy it in shops!). Pretty good portion sizes, too - I'm glad I didn't get a bowl meal because it probably would have been too much for lunch!  The service was fast despite my table being hidden behind a 4 foot wall, which was a relief, and despite being full I got a table pretty quickly.   I'm excited to come back here! It's not quite as groundbreakingly delicious as Cafe Resonance's much smaller all-vegan menu but it's definitely going in my regular rotation.

4.5 stars, really. The food and service are amazing. Seriously, the BLT is as big as your head, and if you close your eyes, it tastes like real bacon. Not for nothing though, I find that a lot of the place's sauces are overly-acidic. The magnificently-crafted Thai Rice Bowl is somewhat diminished by what I see as a saucing that should be slightly thicker, and a little more "peanut-" Despite this, and no pun intended, this place is awesome sauce.
Excellent place!! Delicious food, amazing desserts, family friendly with vegan options available. Fast service with a smile. Love it.
Mmmmm même pour les non végé ;) ils ont un excellent comptoir de produits pour emporter.

If Montreal's winter beauty, adorable vintage glasses clad folk strolling the plateau, or charming architecture did not steal my heart over the weekend, then Aux Vivres sure did the trick.  During my week's visit to Montreal, trying Aux Vivres was one of the most prominent things on my agenda. It sounds silly, but vegan restaurants like this do not come around often in Canada. Vegans, picture going into a restaurant, and being able to eat anything on the menu ever. This drove me crazy. After much debate, I eventually settled for the Kosmo's Plate- an incredible array of seitan, tzatziki, potato wedges, greek salad, rice, etc. I finished off my meal with a pot of soothing chamomile, and the BEST slice of gateau faux-mage (uncheesecake), I have ever been served in a restaurant in my life. I mean that, and I have been to some pretty famous vegan restaurants in my time. That makes me sound like an old woman. I am also a vegan baker myself, and wouldn't have done much differently.  When Montreal and its charming swagger finally wins me over and I decide to move there on a whim one day, this is where I will take all of my non-vegan friends to convert them, and where all of my food dates ever will be. Aux Vivres, I might be in love with you. I don't even care if the feeling is mutual. I love you so much that you can still see other people. :)

Overall we had a great experience here.  It is hard to find nice vegetarian places when traveling.  The smoothies were awesome.  The selections of items were great as well.  The one thing that was a turn off was there secret "cheesecake".  We asked what was in it and was told it was top secret and can't be told.  This was because people might make it at home.  I'm sorry but most people can never make the same recipe from a restaurant even if they try.  I own a restaurant and give away all of my recipes.  I am honored when people ask for recipes.  So of course we skipped dessert :(

Aux Vivres is a great spot- crowded- so we aren't the only ones who think so.  We needed something relatively healthy after many hours in the car travelling from the U.S. and this place definitely delivered in both taste and portion. The burgers are huge- HUGE- and really tasty. I had the Burger Aux Vivres- very veggy-y and tasted amazing. The handcut fries are a great touch as well as the homemade ketchup.   Really no drawback to this place- other than it's popular- so you might have to wait a bit before getting a seat. Absolutely would go back.

Amazing restaurant! There are not many full vegan restaurants around but this is the best one in my opinion. I had the peanut sauce tofu burrito and my friend had the "coconut bacon" burrito. We also had some fresh juices. I recommend the beet apple ginger carrot juice. I've been many times and it never disappoints!
J'ai adoré mon expérience! Le menu est très varié et l'ambiance est charmante.

Aux Vivres is a perfect take-out option and also a great spot for a quick, affordable and different meal ! I absolutely love their Dragon Bowl but many other great options are yours to discover ; fresh juice, vegan chili and BLT sandwich wrap (made with coconut bacon) will please even the strongest meat lovers !

This place on St. Laurent needs no introduction or review. It has its own fan following already, vegans or non-vegans, everyone is crazy about it. I wonder why I forgot to review it earlier. Have been there multiple times. Perfect recipes with a huge variety and good service. It is one of my favorite sunday brunch places. They serve brunch specials with free coffee or tea. Each if their dishes are prepared with a good mix of protein, carbs and fats to start your day, in addition to being presented beautifully. I am super happy with all the wonderful vegan tasty options I have here.

I have been to this restaurant few times, to be honest with you, I am not very impressed with the food. I usually get the burgers, maybe that's my problem. I should branch out to other items on the menu. The burgers are a bit bland and dry for my taste. Last time I was there, I got burned potatoes, like pretty black on the edges. Yes they changed them but come on, the fact that they thought it was ok to give them a customer is already a no no in my books.  The restaurant itself is nice, pretty big and great for groups. The staff is lovely.

Francais plus bas  If somebody has to sell you that they are Vegan and that it isn't that bad and you bought it, it's most likely because you ate at Aux Vivres. I'm currently on a diet and it's tough. It's tough because I can't find what to do except boring salads and healthy sandwiches. Well Aux Vivres has a great variety in the menu. One of the complaint I always do about vegan/vegetarian it's that they hide they crave for meat by creating a weird toffu mixt simili-meat veggie version. I didn't felt that feeling about Aux Vivres. It has a heavy hippie cuisine flavour to it. Really creative vegan cuisine. Slightly asian inspired but also being audacious in some great smoothes (One with Celery, Mango and other stuff I can't remember and tasing awesome is pretty bold. Great portion an UBER-CHEAP. Which explains why it's always pacted.  Si quelqu'un veut vous vendre qu'être végétalien c'est le Paradis et que vous avez embarqué c'est parce qu'il t'as fait manger chez Aux Vivres. Actuellement, je suis sur une diete et c'est difficile d'être créatif avec de la bouffe santé quand t'as étudié en cuisine française (Beurre beurre beurre). Une des plaintes que j'ai de la cuisine Végét (Arien ou Alien) c'est l'obsession de créer des mets qui contient de la simili-viande parce qu'ils sont intrinsèquement carnivore-endormi. Je n'ai pas eut ce feeling chez Aux Vivres. Au contraire, on démontre un menu risqué mais simple avec des plats du jour. Des smoothies qui combien céleri et fruits exotiques - bizarrement délicieux. Il y a une certaine twist asiatique et même fusion mais c'est surtout de la cuisine de hippies avec une tournure bien végétalienne. Belle découverte! et VRAIMENT pas cher, ce qui explique pourquoi la place est toujours remplie.

The ultimate finale for my Montreal visit.  After a day of wandering around the neighborhood looking at the hipsters, vintage shops, and record stores, we decided upon a recommendation to dine at Aux Vivres.  I was starving when I got in which was fortunate because having so many delicious-sounding things was too overwhelming (when I usually get to choose from one or two options on the menu tops) so we ended up ordering an appetizer, smoothie, and dessert to accompany our main courses.  The food was incredible, the decor was adorable, our waiter gamely answered all our weird questions, and we met a group of really nice Montreal-ans who were eating at the table next to us.  Totally worth the bill.

So Aux Vivres has excellent food, it really is comfort food.  They make everything themselves, including the ketchup! In the week we were in Montreal, we went there 3 times just because there were so many things we wanted to try.   They have a special on every day and we tried it twice and it was delicious!   The paratha with homemade veggie butter is not to be missed and their juices and smoothies are excellent. They also sell take outs and desserts as well as their own sauces next door.   The only problems are that because the place is very popular, there is a long line up after 7pm, and the tables are quite small and close together so you end up hearing everything that happens around you.   On the first night, we had to put up with a loud couple who on top of that were rude to the server so it was off putting.   The restaurant is also quite noisy.   All the desserts we tried were amazing. I wish we had an Aux Vivres in Vancouver!

I was very impressed by this place.  Other than the fact that it's overpriced, everything about it was awesome.  Ordered the BLT that looked massive, until you go to pick it up and then it feels light as a feather.  Probably about 75% lettuce, a couple tomato sliced and some (what i think is) roasted coconut and mayo sauce (obviously not real mayo but still quite good). I couldn't tell that the latte didn't have real milk in it.  The restaurant in general looks more like a giant diner than a normal place, and service is kind of slow. If you're vegetarian or are curious about it, it's worth checking out.

Est-ce encore nécessaire de présenter Aux Vivres? Les plats sont délicieux et 100% vegan, du burger jusqu'aux desserts en passant par les bols. Un incontournable à Montréal. Si vous venez pour la première fois, choisissez le tempeh plutôt que le tofu. Aux Vivres a une façon unique de le préparer (et que j'aimerais être capable de répliquer!). Juste à côté du restaurant, il y a également un comptoir à emporter, incluant les plats principaux du restaurant et plusieurs produits d'épicerie difficilement trouvables ailleurs. À savoir toutefois que le menu pour le brunch n'est pas très vaste. Je vous suggère davantage d'y faire un tour pour le dîner ou le souper. Highly recommended overall.

The food here was good.  We started off with an order of cornbread, which I thought was fantastic.  I would never have guessed it was vegan if I didn't know.  The 'butter' didn't really taste buttery but I liked it.  I had a Dragon Bowl and my girlfriend had a veggie burger.  The dragon bowl was the better of the two.  I wish I had a chance to try the coconut bacon but they were all out that night.  Service was good, but the best part was that everything was pretty cheap.
Very good vegan place no raw food there but the staff is awesome and the food is fresh I was a little disappointed that they don't have a lot of soy free option but hey this place is great:)

Première expérience vegan dans un restaurant et vraiment pas décevant! Le gateau pommes-choco etait DÉLICIEUX!!! On pourrait jamais dire que c'est fait sans oeufs ni produits laitiers! Service rapide en plus :)

Simply amazing vegan food! The BLT chapati sandwich was massive - the coconut bacon definitely stole the show. We also ordered the chilli fries. Both are must-tries. You can tell everything is made with fresh and quality ingredients. A homey diner feel with bomb indie/soul music Only downside is that service was incredibly slow (worth the wait though!)

Mon resto végétalien (vegan) favori à Montréal, comme plusieurs autres, j'imagine ! Ouvert depuis 1997, je suis un client depuis quelques années déjà, j'y viens lorsque je veux manger santé et je prends généralement mon plat chouchou, le ''bol dragon avec tempeh''. Menu très varié pour les végétaliens mais aussi pour tout le monde, jus frais / smoothies / sandwichs / salades / burgers / desserts...Ils servent aussi des brunchs les week-ends. Ce restaurant est toujours plein et très populaire. Déco rétro. Service rapide. Prix raisonables & grosses portions. Seul truc que je déplore, la malpropreté des toilettes, ça aurait besoin de rénover et nettoyé. Je donne quand même 5/5 car on vient ici après tout pour de la bouffe santé vegan. Ils ont une petite boutique à côté du restaurant pour acheter leurs produits.  5/5 visité en juillet 2016

Vegan food and fresh juices are O.K. It will please individuals who like diner-style food. Portions are large and prices are moderate. While the food is edible and will fill you up, it is certainly flavorless. You definitely pay what you get. Service is friendly.

10 janvier 2013 Un saut chez les végétariens. Curieux ? oui ! Herbivore à mes heures, c'est toujours bon d'explorer et d'essayer d'autres plats, comme maman disait. De bons jus/smoothies. Je fais un saut en compagnie d'une charmante brunette asiatique. J'essaye le tonique (gimgembre, pomme, citron) ! WOW ! Un snack ? Pourquoi pas. J'essaye le sandwich Mekong (Tofu, corriande, laitue, carottes, daikon, menthe, sauce thaï aux arachides). Malheureusement, on ne goûte pas la sauce aux arachides et le tortilla géant dans lequel c'est servi ne tient pas la route avec une sauce au basilic trop abondante. La sauce thaï aux arachides, c'est pas ça. Tout se défait, ça se mange très mal. Il y a beaucoup trop de laitue pour rien. Moins, c'est TOUJOURS plus. Il faut qu'on puisse bien sentir les saveurs et qu'on puisse apprécier la croustillance des divers ingrédients sinon c'est peine perdue.  L'ambiance globale est très bruyante. C'est dommage lorsqu'on veut discuter avec une charmante demoiselle assise à notre table :-)  January 10th 2013 A jump with the vegetarians. Curious ? yes ! Herbivor on occasions, it's always good to explore and try new meals, like mom always said. I decide to make the jump accompanied by a splendidly charming asian brunette. Good juices/smoothies. I try the tonic (ginger, apple, lemon) ! WOW ! A good snack ? Why not. I try the Mekong sandwich (Tofu, coriander, lettuce, carrots, daikon, mint, thaï peanuts sauce). Unfortunatly,  you don't taste the thaï peanuts sauce within a giant tortilla filled with too much basil sauce instead. The tortilla doesn't stand, it crumbles completely and it's really messy. Thaï peanuts sauce it is not. There is too much lettuce for not much result. Less is ALWAYS more. It is premordial to be able to taste all the flavors if you want to call it a good sandwich. You need to appreciate the crunchyness of seperate ingredients in your mouth when you bite otherwise it's just a lump of anything.  The general loudness of the place is a problem when you want to sit down and talk with a charming lady, at your table :-)

I'm not a vegetarian or a vegan but sometimes you just need to eat healthy without having to compromise on taste. I came to Aux Vivres for the first time today, I don't know why it took me so long to try it since I've been hearing about this place for years from friends both in and out of the yoga scene (where they are all vegan practically these days). I usually have a lot of misgivings about veggie restos because sometimes the drinks taste like grass and the food is usually tofu or tempeh done up in such a way to hide the blandness of the meat substitute. I was actually quite surprised, I ordered the mango lassi, a large vegetarian chilli and tried out their choco-banana torte and it was all very tasty. All the tables around me had food like salads, sandwiches, chapati bread and it all looked super fresh and vibrant, people were clearly enjoying their food and lingering over their lunches with their friends. The vibe here is very casual and friendly and well-lit and bright. Next time I come, I'm bringing a big book so I can read while I try their coconut bacon in a sandwich and some of their other desserts because it's so chill here.

I am not a vegan, but I still enjoy this place. Never ate in but ordered out a few times. I go pretty often to their little grocery store next to the restaurant.   The prepared pita wraps are good... Some very good. Steer away from the scirocco... The taste is ok but the condiments wet the pita making for a very mushy sandwich.  The desserts are decent. The salads are great. The guacamole is particularly good.  Where it felt short: the famous BLT. The first bites are good, but it is SO sweet, you will be unable to finish it. Same problem with the cornbread and the peanut sauce. Too sweet!  Why only 2 stars: they charge 34.99$ for a regular apple pie! I never complain on price, but that is unacceptable.

Whenever I'm studying, I love ordering from here as they have awesome food. It's a bonus that they have several gluten-free options - very accommodating for those with allergies.  Their menu is super detailed and you know exactly what ingredients every dish includes. The portions are perfect, and the prices are super reasonable. Two doors north of the store they even have another store where they sell some of their dishes/ desserts as well as several other vegan products.  The only downside was that the service was a little bit slow, but the food definitely made up for it. I would 100% recommend Aux Vivres!

We had brunch here on a weekday during a quick trip to Montreal. As we entered, we were surprised at how busy the restaurant was, but we were actually seated and served rather quickly.  We ordered: -earl grey tea  -blt wrap -Mexican soul food plate (forgot the actual name of it- sorry!)   The tea came in a pot and I wasn't given and creamer or milk with it. This was a bit disappointing but the tea on its own had a great depth of flavour, which made up for the lack of soy milk.  The BLT wrap was giant in portion size and very filling. It was well enjoyed and was balanced in its flavours and textures.  The Mexican soul food plate had chilli, brown rice, salad, and corn tortillas. This dish was gluten free and I highly recommend it. Extremely filling, delicious, well seasoned, and incredible value.   The food was served extremely quickly and managed to maintain a beautiful presentation still. The staff knows what they're doing at all times- they were very attentive and made sure every guest was taken care of.  Highly recommend for quick vegan meal with gluten free options in the city! I hope to be back to try the weekend brunch!

??I've never been to a completely vegan establishment before since I'm an omnivore, but a friend of ours suggested us this place while we were visiting and I thought, why not.  Can't explain how surprised I was ?by the deliciousness of things. We only came for coffee ?and a dessert, but still. Maybe if we return some day I'll order a main dish as well (or just a ton of desserts), but for now...  ... the desserts were amazingly good (not cheap though, keep that in mind). I had the Gâteau Faux-Mage. Heavenly! Seriously?!? It was waaaaay better than a typical cheesecake you can order anywhere else.? I'd kill to have the recipe and be able to ?make it at home ?myself ?over and over. Husband ordered Apple Pie which was great as well, but the Uncheesecake got me so bad I hardly wanted to try his dessert. :)  Coffee came with almond milk and so did my Earl Grey tea. Both great.  This place has very friendly staff. They speak English and menu has two sides - French and English. What ??more could one want? I'd give them 10 stars if I could. :)?
Order a Ginger Tonic as a drink. With a coconut BLT. So good.

Amazing Vegan food in Montreal, went here as my last meal while visiting, and had brunch on a sunday, this place was pretty full within 10 minutes of opening.  Their smoothies are amazing.  I had a complete brunch breakfast with a tofu scramble and cornbread and tempeh bacon...it was amazing, i polished my plate off in 10 minutes. The soy creamer here is also great in their coffee...decently priced, great service. highly recommended!

Stopped in for dessert and tea. Desserts were nothing special - cakes, cookies, and brownies. Was expecting something more creative. Carrot cake was a little dry but the chocolate desserts were a little better. Many other vegan options in town so I doubt I'd recommend this as a must-do.

First of all I'm a bit of a carnivore, but having eaten my fair share of poutine the night before I was dying for some healthy food!   Luckily on my trip to Montreal, my lovely friend and host is vegetarian and this was the first place she took me to and boy was I pleased!  Aux Vivres is bright and lively, beautifully furnished with a cool trendy atmosphere. Reminds me of a diner but with a brand new juice bar and with wooden furnishings. Tres Cool.   There's a good selection of smoothies, fruit juices, espressos, teas, organic everything - then sandwiches, burgers, rice bowls, and more! They even had a glossary of terms for non-vegans like me that don't know what Tempeh was!   I got the Tofu Burger ($11) with an Organic Soda (2.50). The Tofu burger has this great oniony/mustardy spread and it came with yummy hand cut chunky wedges with a chipotle tomato sauce, and some coleslaw. Everything was pretty tasty - but I kinda looked over and wish I'd gotten the Aux Vivre burger now!  My friend got a Souvlakian plate(?) and she said it was really good.   All in all DEFINITELY would come back here, get a smoothie and try a bowl - the food is so bright, colorful and healthy it makes me happy to not have any Poutine for awhile!

Tout est bon ! Les bols dragon et thai ont ma preference mais les sandwichs le sont tout autant ! C'est toujours la lutte pour choisir entre mes traditionnels et le special du jour ! Je reviendrai (encore) pour tester le brunch !
I have such a soft spot for Aux vivres. Met a special person there for the first time. Plenty of options, nice open space and Food was on point.

I support this place because it's fully vegan and offers an amazing menu. Nevertheless I wasn't completely convinced by the food. I ordered the Kosmos Plate, at 14.95 CAD the most expensive dish on the menu. Unfortunately the "souvlaki-style tempeh" didn't look or taste like souvlaki, the "pita' was anything but Greek pita, and the potato wedges were just not good and a bit on the raw side. The only thing worthy of its name was the tzatziki. As a half-Greek I can confirm that the taste was pretty close to the original. For dessert I ordered the "cheesecake" but that also didn't taste of much. I'm hoping I just made some poor choices and the rest of the menu is better executed. Maybe the breakfast options or the burgers will win me over next time. I'm not giving up on you Aux Vivres!

I went to Aux Vivres with my parents (who are vegan) and we weren't too impressed. The dishes had exotic flavors which I appreciated, but I didn't leave satisfied at all.  We had the dragon bowl, the buddha bowl with tempeh and the coconut blt wrap. All were okay. I probably wouldn't go back.

How much do I absolutely adore Aux Vivre? Enough to go daily... and twice in one day! They boast such a vibrant menu chock full of both healthy and indulgent vegan dishes, plus desserts, smoothies and juices, that any vegan/vegetarian/omnivore should be satisfied.   What I love the most:  -Popeye juice It's so gingery and refreshing! Even if you're the type who suffers through their glass of green juice if it's super green, this one is sure to change your mind.   -La Polenta (on the brunch menu-- available only on the weekend) My god, this plate is absolutely what the doctor ordered. It's hearty and delicious, with big hunks of tasty polenta over refried beans + zesty tofu scramble(cooked with nutritional yeast), perfect guac and salad (that dilly dressing is dreamy). The perfect plate if you don't actually eat until the mid afternoon when you realize you're fucking starving.   -Buddha Bowl It's simply a huge bowl, abundant with veggies, rice and grilled tofu that is out of this world delicious. But what really takes it to the next level is that ramekin of Buddha sauce (think: umami and not sweet!)  And this may not seem like a big deal to you, but their soy cappuccinos are perfection. Coming from an espresso fanatic!  This is more of a note for me and shouldn't discourage you at all, but I wasn't crazy about the the BLT because I prefer a more savory fake bacon, maybe made of tempeh, rather than the sweet coconut variety, also way too much mayo. The wrap isn't my favorite kind, but that's because I'm weird about wraps and probably shouldn't order them. But! My friend couldn't go on ENOUGH about how spectacular the Dragon wrap is and just know that it holds up to the next day as she took it to go!   Final note: The key lime pie is disappointing. To be fair, I took it to go and perhaps it just needs to be eaten immediately, but it appeared rather unappetizing when I first received it and when I went to eat it later, I found it inedible (mainly because the texture is too gelatinous). I'm sure their other desserts are much better! They appear quite enticing, for sure.  Besides the great options for all and the fact that Aux Vivre is Montreal's very first vegan restaurant (kudos, mes amis!) I want to note that I just love every waitress I've ever had here. They are the sweetest girls and really take good care of you, even when you're there, ahem, past closing (sorry to be THAT table, but thank you, Aux Vivre, for being open so late because *this* vegan often doesn't sit down to dinner til 10pm!)

Aux Vivres, the staple of Vegan Montrealers and foodies alike. Originally fashioned as a sandwich and smoothie bar (and still retaining these qualities), Michael Makhan (owner, chef, menu designer) expanded to a full size restaurant in 2005.  Although the entire menu is strong, Aux Vivres remains strongest in their fundamentals: sandwiches. The BLT (with smoked coconut bacon) is a must, and the option to put it on chapati should not be an option - there is no other way to have it. Two of their seitan based sandwiches are among my faves: their Montreal smoked meat, and their gyro. I know some meat eaters would cringe at the thought of using a meat substitute in such venerated meals - but trust me, your palate will thank you.  In other options are their bowls, which while good, I'm not overly blown away by, as this is closer to something I can make on my own. The dragon bowl is probably the best here.  In their comfort foods section, their chilli and chilli fries are both great, as well as their "Mumbai plate", a terrific fusion dish of Indian flavours.  The only downside is that they have no alcohol license (bring your own nor table service), and the setting is just not that welcoming for languishing after a meal. But they've got it where it counts, the food.

Went with my wife, 2 daughters, my niece, and her girlfriend. We were seated quickly. We ordered snacks (fries, light sandwich) and then some desserts. The desserts were the real reason we went. The milkshakes were to die for. We have dairy and gluten issues in the group and they accommodated without an issue. They would have 5 stars if the service had been faster - the server quite literally walked past our table several times while we were calling out and did not come. Even when we did so in native french (as we had a couple of french as first language folks with us). But I'd be willing to bet it's an anomaly and I'll give them the next star if I go back and see different. The food and atmosphere were directly on target.

I love the food here. Recently I have been really into tempeh, organic food, and in the end vegan food. This is a great restaurant to convert people to the way of the bean, soy bean that is. I've eaten take out, where I mostly order the Dragon bowl. It is filling and delicious, it's a must have along with grilled tempeh.  On one of my more recent trips I order a the living salad (I think) with tempeh and it was great and surprisingly filling. To start that day we had the corn bread with guacamole, very good. I've had it with both the guacamole and veggie butter, my favorite is with the guacamole, however I think everyone must try the veggie butter. I also shared the Uncheescake Cheesecake which was very good, I am still wondering what they put in it to make it soooooo good.   If you are a vegan or enjoy eating healthy you must stop by here. If you want to bring some friends to try their first taste of a vegan restaurant, this is a great choice.
great place you walk out feeling UNGUILTY about eating ofcourse the sauces r fat but so what

One of the most legit vegan restaurants I've ever been to, period! And I've been to many! The bowls are fan.fucking.tastic. And I'm an unapologetic omni. I could turn veg if I had access to this place on a regular basis. I love bowls with raw veg in them for some reason and they make it so, so, so, good and not like some cheap imitation of omni food.

The best in Ontario and Quebec that I have had. Great tasting food and reasonably priced.   Service is very good and atmosphere is pleasant for any type of outing. Always make it a stop when visiting Montreal. It is also in a great location.

As a vegetarian, this was my favorite restaurant during our Montreal visit.    First time, we ordered take out via the ala carte delivery service (like seamless in the US).  When the food arrived (Buddha bowl, a wrap and the apple pie), it was cold due to the winter weather and didn't warm us up after our long day snowboarding.  Needless to say, we were disappointed.  This was the place my best friend recommended us to try in Montreal.     Second time, we decided to give the restaurant another try in person and we came on a sunday night, the last supper of Montreal.  Surprisingly, it was packed.  The red seats and decor are intimate and trendy, suitable for a romantic date.  This time, we ordered the Masala plate (chickpea and potato curry with chutney) and the chocolate banana pie for dessert.  The entree was warm, fresh, tasty, and filling.  And dessert was delicious and more impressively, it did not leave a poor after taste as most desserts usually do.  For drinks, we had the chai; it's unique because it uses soy milk instead of dairy milk.  My girlfriend, who is picky about food, was impressed with Aux Vivres. We would definitely come back here if/when we come back to Montreal.

Was in Montreal for four days and ate here twice! The food is excellent, the wait staff is friendly, attentive and quick.  The polenta during the weekend brunch is AWESOME!  I'll be sure to come back on my next trip to Montreal.

The lunch here is so-so but the brunches are bordering on fantastic. The veggie 'meats' are tasty and cooked just right but the soy milk they give you for the less than impressive coffee just ain't right, it curdles, YUCK!  I would have given this place 4 stars, but on my last visit, I was meeting a friend for brunch. She has a Mira dog named Joey that has to be with her at all times as he is in training. He is well mannered, sits under the table and sleeps the entire time. As he was snoozing away and other patrons were smiling at him, the manager walked over and explained that she knows what a Mira dog is and informed us that she called Mira and was told that she does not have to accept the dog into her restaurant.  No one complained about him and we were thrown out...but not before they made me pay the 5,50$ for the smoothie that I was sipping on while waiting for my friend to arrive. I was stunned that they would make me pay given that we were being tossed out into the cold because of the Mira dog and so I handed over 6$ to which she said "sorry, I don't have any change unless I go and open the till."  Joey has been to restaurants all over Montreal: fancy and casual and has never been unwelcome before. And here I thought that vegans were animal-friendly, guess not!

I bring all my friends here. My favorite foods for take out are :  The veggie butter is amazing and a great addition to a sandwich or just a plain bread.  Coconut bacon is an awesome meat alternative. The texture and flavor is so unique and very distinctive, you can add in your salad, to give it am extra crunch   My only issue with aux vivre is the Indian food, maybe my standard are a bit high . I have eaten Indian food my whole life and I know what it is suppose to taste like. There is little to know flavor and the chickpeas are always hard. My friends that visited me from India agreed with me.

Pour une cuisine vegan, réconfortante et originale, je vous conseille plutôt Antidote Café, du côté d'Hochelaga.  À Aux Vivres, mon petit copain Kevin, a pris une assiette type tempeh et pomme de terre avec salade sans gout pour masquer le manque de cuisine.  Déjà fait chez soit 5 fois plus savoureux en 10 min en rentrant du boulot.  Alors que pourtant je travaille beaucoup.  Pour ma part j'avais pris le burger vegan, celui qui te donne envie de remanger de la viande.  Si vous voulez vraiment rester vegan, allez gouter un burger chez Lola Rosa plutôt ;)

It's so cool to have this in Montreal - be warned: come in starving because their portion sizes are large and the food is too good to not finish.   The fifth missing star is for a lack of attentive service.

I'm so in love with this restaurant! Their menu is diversify and everything is good. I already taste the dragon wrap and the deluxe salad both are delicious. Even if you aren't vegetarians you will love it.

Stop whatever you are doing and go here. Now. Vegan or not, the food is amazing. If you don't like sweet main dishes (and I don't) avoid the dishes with the Thai peanut sauce. I found them to be horrendously sweet. However, the dragon bowl is on a higher plane of existence. I hate beets but loved them in here.   The tempeh burger is so good that I actually enjoyed the Taste and texture of it. I really don't like tempeh. The chili is warming and comforting. Avoid the chili fries. The potatoes are cut too large for it to work well. However the chili and corn nachos is worth it.   The blt with coconut bacon is refreshing and not as weird as it sounds. I've never et bacon before, so I have no frame of reference but as a sandwich the dish is a solid win.   Cheesecake is dense and rich. Carrot cake is loaded with big flavour. The mango lassi is creamy and tart but not too much like a yoghurt drink as I recall lassi to be. Still tasty in its own right. The creamsicle smoothie is exactly what it says it is.   Waitstaff are extremely friendly, and attractive. Decor is a little like a diner but still nice looking. Prices are reasonable for the mountains of food you're getting. Sandwiches are served on chapati and not bread so they are easier to pick up and eat. Not at all messy. Great place to bring a date. Just get one appetiser, one main, and one dessert to share and you'll both be pleasantly full.   This restaurant has  its act together.

Holy giant/cheap/delicious vegan sandwiches, batman! This is a must-do when I'm in Montreal and anyone who joins me adds it to their must-do list as well.   We were on a tight schedule so we did a call-ahead order. Hmm... there are going to be 5-7 of us eating, so maybe we'll get six sandwiches? After all, they're only about $10 each.  We picked up our order and started unpacking the sandwiches. I thought I was cutting them in half, but really I was slicing each half into a quarter. These are like giant burrito sandwiches (I would call them wraps), and one is easily enough for two (hungry) people.   As you may have guessed, six sandwiches was about twice as much as we actually needed. But it worked out, because we wrapped up the remainders and saved it for dinner to-go the next day.   Every item was tasty, but stop everything and get the BLT. Flaky and tender smoked coconut ("bacon"), lettuce, tomato, and vegan mayonnaise. We have smoked coconut at a place here in Rochester, but this is easily superior. It has the meaty texture of coconut, the smokiness of bacon, but still a strong sweet coconut flavor.   Get your hungry tummy over to Aux Vivres and fill it up right.
Bonne option santé, restaurant et comptoir rapide à l'autre porte. Jus frais, smoothies , burritos, chips d'epinard et laitue à 10$ lol ( joking ) etc ...

Get the Me-kong sandwich on chapati, but ask for the sauce on the side. I'm gonna ask for that next time since the past 3 times i've had it there, it has been soaked with sauce. Also love their orange creamsicle smoothie, the chipotle brownies, the BLT, and they have a decent tea selection. Oh and lattes are nice too. Go in the summer! They have a lovely outdoor seating area, decorated with lanterns and plants and herbs. ALSO: Tegan AND Sara eat there ;)

I've been to Aux Vivres more times than its worth counting for over the years. That being said, I've seen this place change somewhat radically in terms of atmosphere, food and service, which makes it all the harder to review. At another time I could count on a quality Mekong sandwich large enough to be shared between two broke folks- now I find the lunch and dinner quantities underwhelming and the sauce overbearing. Definitely not the kind of meal to be shared. This is also accompanied by a different atmosphere- it's not the intimate little vegan nook it once was.  I wouldn't recommend visiting the joint for anything other than brunch- which is the only legit. vegan brunch I can really vouch for in the city (check out that perfectly cooked polenta!).
D'après mon expérience un des meilleurs resto vegan à Montréal où on peut bruncher, dîner  ou souper. Je recommande !

LA POLENTA: This is only on the brunch menu. The polenta wasn't as flavored as I'd hoped it would be, but I loved this plate for brunch. It's so good and definitely filling but not in a way where you need a nap after.  DRAGON BOWL: Oh my glob, so good. That sauce though... It's a huge bowl of veggies with an amazing sauce. I don't know what kind of food they have in the afterlife, but I hope it's a shit ton of this. I want to try ALL OF THE BOWLS. Scratch that - I WANT TO TRY THE ENTIRE MENU.  THE PLACE: It's big and friendly. Is friendly a word you can use to describe a place? I don't know, but I love Aux Vivres. I want one in LA. Now. Also there's a to-go location next door. I wish I took advantage of that.

Excellent vegan food. Fantastic menu! Generous portions. Can't go wrong...especially when you live a three minute walk away like I do!   They have a diverse menu. Smoothies and juices, comfort food, salads, sandwiches, bowls, burgers, cornbread, chilli, and deserts. They also have brunch on the weekends which I have yet to try but it looks really tasty!   The Mexicali Plate is very satisfying for a chilly day and completely filling! It is house chili, brown rice, guacamole, sour cream, tortillas, and a side salad. It is one of my favorite things on the menu! The chili is so delicious you won't miss the meat!   Another favourite is the Dragon bowl or the Dragon sandwich. The sandwich is very big and served in chipati which is so tasty! It is stuffed with goodness: tofu, beets, carrots, red cabbage, daikon, lettuce, sprouts, and their special 'dragon sauce'. The bowl is essentially the same thing as the sandwich, but in a bowl served on brown rice. They also offer tempeh for an additional cost.   My absolute favourite desert there leaves me so happy that I get it every time and I haven't ordered any other deserts because I don't know if they will be as good as this: the chipotle brownie. It is huge! I think it is $4.25 but totally worth it. It is a chocolate delight!   I can't wait to try more of their menu!   They also offer take out but you order it in the store entrance rather than the restaurant. They have a nice little bar you can eat at in there and it has much more of a coffee shop feel than the restaurant.
Disclaimer: carnivore review. I know this sounds nuts, but I had one of the best BLTs of my life here. And the smoothies are totally on point. I actually went twice in one day...

In a city where hot dogs, submarine sandwiches and poutine are considered staples - this restaurant appears as an oasis.  I love the menu and recommend the channa sandwich. I have had better smoothies but the desserts looked delightful and plenty of choices.

My wife and I have been going to Aux Vivres for a couple of years now and every time we go there, we come out extremely satisfied. Their food as well as their service to their clientele is excellent! Strongly recommended.

To balance out the poutine we ate while in Montreal, we sought out some restaurants on the healthier side of the spectrum.   Aux Vivres was one such restaurant that was not only healthy but truly satisfying. My Thai sandwich wrap was really flavorful and filling, and the Creamsicle smoothie tasted sweet but not sinful.  Prices are pretty reasonable, too, with dinner for 2 coming out to about CAD$30.  Service was pretty laid-back -- for the first 10 minutes, we wondered whether we actually had a server. Perhaps they were just making the Americans chill out for a minute...
